name: bombast
example: 单词 bombast 的例句||||There was no bombast or conceit in his speech. 他的演讲并没有夸大其词和自吹自擂。||||Yasha realized that Wolsky's bombast was unnecessary. 雅夏看出沃尔斯基是在无中生有地吹嘘。

name: boor
example: 单词 boor 的例句||||I'm a bit of a boor, so I hope you won't mind if I speak bluntly. 我是一个粗人，说话直来直去，你可别见怪。||||He is skettical to the intellectual, and he despises the boor. 他对知识分子有戒心，更瞧不起乡下人。

name: blasphemy
example: 单词 blasphemy 的例句||||His writings were branded as obscene and a blasphemy against God. 他的著作被定为淫秽作品，是对上帝的亵渎。||||You have just heard his blasphemy! 你刚刚听到他那番亵渎上帝的话了!

name: blazon
interpret: n.纹章，装饰；精确描绘；v.广布；宣布
example: 单词 blazon 的例句||||I believe Shakespeare wants to blazon forth a notion of disciplinary well-ordered and morality. 我认为莎士比亚想宣扬一种有纪律有秩序有道德的社会主张。||||

name: braggadocio
example: 单词 braggadocio 的例句||||He was disliked because his manner was always full of braggadocio. 人们讨厌他，因为他老是吹牛。||||Underneath his goofball braggadocio lies a kind of purity. 在他笨拙的自夸里蕴含着一丝纯洁。

name: blockage
example: 单词 blockage 的例句||||The logical treatment is to remove this blockage. 合理的治疗方法就是清除堵塞物。||||If the blockage worked, they could retreat with dignity. 如果封锁发生作用，他们可以体面地撤退。

name: brat
example: 单词 brat 的例句||||He's a spoilt brat. 他是一个被宠坏了的调皮孩子。||||The brat sicked his dog on the passer-by. 那个顽童纵狗去咬过路人。

name: bluster
interpret: vt. 咆哮；狂吹；夸口；威吓；气势汹汹地说 vi. 咆哮；恫吓 n. 怒号；吓唬
example: 单词 bluster 的例句||||We could hear the bluster of the wind and rain. 我们能听到狂风暴雨的吹打声。||||He was inclined to bluster at first, but he soon dropped. 起初他老爱吵闹一阵，可是不久就不做声了。

name: browbeat
example: 单词 browbeat 的例句||||They browbeat him into signing the document. 他们威逼他签署了文件。||||The judge browbeat the witness. 那法官威吓证人。

name: buffoon
example: 单词 buffoon 的例句||||They pictured their manager as a buffoon. 他们把经理描绘成一个小丑。||||That politician acted like a buffoon during that debate. 这个政客在那场辩论中真是丑态百出。

name: caucus
interpret: n.秘密会议；干部会议；v.（参加）干部开会议
example: 单词 caucus 的例句||||This multi-staged caucus takes several months. 这个多级会议常常历时好几个月。||||It kept the Democratic caucus from fragmenting. 它也使得民主党的核心小组避免了土崩瓦解的危险。

name: byline
example: 单词 byline 的例句||||His byline was absent as well. 他的署名也不见了。||||We wish to thank the author of this article which carries no byline. 我们要感谢这篇文章的那位没有署名的作者。

name: charade
interpret: n.用动作等表演文字意义的字谜游戏
example: 单词 charade 的例句||||You must not refine too much upon this charade. 你切不可过分推敲这个字谜。||||His poems, despite their dignity and felicity, have an air of charade. 他的诗篇虽然庄严巧妙，却有猜迷之嫌。

name: clemency
example: 单词 clemency 的例句||||The question of clemency would rest with the King. 宽大处理问题，将由国王决定。||||They addressed to the governor a plea for clemency. 他们向州长提交了宽刑的申辨书。

name: clement
example: 单词 clement 的例句||||A clement judge reduced his sentence. 一位仁慈的法官为他减了刑。||||The planet's history contains many less stable and clement eras than the holocene. 地球的历史包含着许多不如全新世稳定与温和的地质时期。

name: collage
interpret: n.拼贴画；v.拼贴；把……创作成拼贴画
example: 单词 collage 的例句||||A collage of coloured paper covers a table top. 一副彩纸拼贴画盖在桌面上。||||He has used a mixture of mosaic, collage and felt-tip pen. 他混合使用了马赛克，拼贴画和毡头笔。

name: cistern
example: 单词 cistern 的例句||||The cistern is empty but soon fills again. 蓄水池里现在没水，但不久就会储满水的。||||The lavatory cistern overflowed. 厕所水箱的水溢出来了

name: cloying
example: 单词 cloying 的例句||||Her cheap, cloying scent enveloped him. 她那廉价香水甜腻熏人的气味一下子包围了他。||||His particular trademark is a cute and cloying sentimentality. 他独特的标志是做作的、让人反感的多愁善感。

name: coagulant
example: 单词 coagulant 的例句||||Increased coagulant dosage results in greater sludge yield for ultimate disposal. 增加凝聚剂用量会增大最后处理的污泥量。||||The ice cream of this brand has too much coagulant. 这个牌子的冰淇淋添加了过多的凝固剂。

name: clarion
example: 单词 clarion 的例句||||Clarion calls to liberation had been mocked when we stood by. 当我们袖手旁观的时候，自由解放的号角声遭到了嘲弄。||||To all the people present, his speech is a clarion call. 对所有在场的人而言，他的演讲都是动人的号召。

name: foghorn
example: 单词 foghorn 的例句||||The foghorn boomed out its warning. 雾角鸣声示警。||||The ship foghorn boomed out. 船上的浓雾号角发出呜呜声。

name: ferromagnetic
example: 单词 ferromagnetic 的例句||||Materials which have magnetic properties similar to iron are ferromagnetic. 具有类似于铁那样的磁性的材料就是铁磁物质。||||It is sometimes difficult to draw the line separating ferromagnetic from paramagnetic substances. 严格区别铁磁性与顺磁性物质有时是很困难的。

name: frisky
interpret: adj.活泼的，欢闹的；n.活泼，闹着玩；adv.活泼地，闹着玩地
example: 单词 frisky 的例句||||I felt frisky, as if I might break into a dance. 我感到很欢快，似乎要跳起舞来。||||His horse was feeling frisky, and he had to hold the reins tightly. 马儿欢蹦乱跳，他不得不紧勒缰绳。

name: inactivate
example: 单词 inactivate 的例句||||We put bacteria in an environment at low temperature to inactivate them. 我们将细菌置於低温的环境中使之失去活性。||||Food processing destroys some nutrients, but can also inactivate toxins and increase the availability of other nutrients. 食物加工破坏一些营养物质，但也可以灭活毒素, 并增加其他营养物质的可用性。

name: indented
interpret: adj.锯齿状的，高低不平的；缩进排版
example: 单词 indented 的例句||||His voyage was down Chile's indented coastline. 他的航行沿智利参差曲折的海岸线行进。||||Each paragraph of the body is usually indented five blocks. 正文每段开始，一般缩进五个英文字母。

name: irreverence
example: 单词 irreverence 的例句||||True irreverence is disrespect for another man's god. 真正的大不敬是不尊重别人的神。||||Mark Twain said irreverence is the champion of liberty, if not its only defender. 马克·吐温说过，不敬若不是自由唯一的捍卫者，也会是它的拥护者。

name: monochromatic
example: 单词 monochromatic 的例句||||The resolution of white light into its separate monochromatic components is called dispersion. 这种白光分解为各单色成分的现象叫做色散。||||My sister selected a monochromatic color-scheme for her new apartment. 我妹妹为自己的新居选择了单一色调的设计。

name: percolate
interpret: vi. 过滤；渗出；浸透 vt. 使渗出；使过滤 n. 滤过液；渗出液
example: 单词 percolate 的例句||||The rain will percolate through the soil. 雨水渗入土中。||||New fashions took a long time to percolate down. 新时尚要很长时间才能在大众中流行起来。

name: pestilence
example: 单词 pestilence 的例句||||They were crazed by the famine and pestilence of that bitter winter. 他们因那年严冬的饥饿与瘟疫而折磨得发狂。||||A pestilence was raging in that area. 瘟疫正在那一地区流行。

name: pliant
example: 单词 pliant 的例句||||She's proud and stubborn, you know, under that pliant exterior. 你要知道，在温顺的外表下，她既自傲又固执。||||They weave a basket out of pliant osiers. 他们用易弯的柳枝编制篮子。

name: portraiture
example: 单词 portraiture 的例句||||I am going to have my portraiture taken. 我请人给自己画张肖像。||||The painting of beautiful women was another field of portraiture. 人物画中的另一个领域是仕女画。

name: portrayal
example: 单词 portrayal 的例句||||His novel is a vivid portrayal of life in a mining community. 他的小说生动地描绘了矿区的生活。||||The portrayal of the characters in the novel is lifelike. 该书中的人物写得有血有肉。

name: regimentation
interpret: n.编组团队；系统化，组织化
example: 单词 regimentation 的例句||||They don't want equality and regimentation. 他们不要一律平等和严密的组织。||||Discipline without regimentation was Miss Bulstrode's motto. 既注意纪律，又不造成一律化，这就是布尔斯特罗德小姐的座右铭。

name: rendering
example: 单词 rendering 的例句||||She gave a splendid rendering of Beethoven's piano sonata. 她精彩地演奏了贝多芬的钢琴奏鸣曲。||||His narrative is a super rendering of dialect speech and idiom. 他的叙述是方言和土语最成功的运用。

name: silicate
example: 单词 silicate 的例句||||There are large amounts of aluminum silicate in the area. 这个地区有大量的硅酸铝。||||Silicate minerals are characteristically refractory and difficult to break down. 硅酸盐矿物的特点是耐熔和难以分离。

name: spoilage
example: 单词 spoilage 的例句||||He was determined to track down the cause of food spoilage. 他决心查出食品腐烂的原因。||||The principal methods of avoiding spoilage are the use of pure yeast strains as starters. 防止啤酒变坏的主要方法是用纯酵母菌株发酵。

name: spiny
interpret: adj.多刺的，刺状的；n.多刺的东西
example: 单词 spiny 的例句||||This is the Asiatic ornamental shrub with spiny branches and pink blossoms. 这就是亚洲的一种观赏灌木，具有多刺的枝和粉红色的花。||||Stay away from a spiny cactus. 远离多刺仙人掌。

name: stagecoach
example: 单词 stagecoach 的例句||||She's getting off the stagecoach. 她正在下马车。||||The stagecoach driver cracked the whip. 驿站马车的车夫抽响了鞭子。

name: swampy
example: 单词 swampy 的例句||||Malaria is still rampant in some swampy regions. 疟疾在一些沼泽地区仍很猖獗。||||An ox is grazing in a swampy meadow. 一头牛在一块泥泞的草地上吃草。

name: symbiosis
example: 单词 symbiosis 的例句||||They live in a symbiosis with governments that they are financing. 他们与他们服务的政府互利共存。||||The symbiosis between social values and political structure has produced extraordinary achievement. 社会价值观念和政治结构的共生现象带来了非凡的成就。

name: superannuated
interpret: adj.老朽的，退休的；v.因落后于时代而废除，勒令退学
example: 单词 superannuated 的例句||||Are you still riding that superannuated old bike? 你还骑那辆老掉牙的自行车吗？||||No one supports these superannuated policies. 没人支持这些过时的政策。

name: putrid
interpret: adj.腐臭的；有毒的；已腐烂的；卑劣的
example: 单词 putrid 的例句||||To eat putrid food is liable to get sick. 吃了腐败的食物容易生病。||||A putrid smell drove us from the room. 一股腐臭的气味迫使我们离开这房间。

name: supernal
example: 单词 supernal 的例句||||The supernal ideology will not coexistence with the everyman. 超凡的思想是不会与凡夫俗子共存的。||||It has virtue of strong function, supernal efficiency. 它具有功能强，效率高的优点。

name: subliminal
interpret: adj.下意识的，潜意识的；太弱或太快以至于难以觉察的
example: 单词 subliminal 的例句||||Maybe they're getting it on a subliminal level. 也许他们会在潜意识里这么以为。||||The soft sell approach gets to consumers in a subliminal way. 软广告通过潜意识的作用来影响消费者。

name: blase
example: 单词 blase 的例句||||She's very blase about parties. 她非常腻烦聚会。||||The film star is blase about endless flattery now. 那位电影明星现在对无休无止的吹捧已经厌烦了。

name: bode
interpret: vt. 预示；为…的兆头 vi. 预示 v. 停留；继续；遭到（bide的过去式）
example: 单词 bode 的例句||||These figures do not bode well for the company's future. 这些数字显示出公司的前景不妙。||||His careful habits bode well for his future. 他那认真的习惯预示著他会有好的前途。

name: chassis
interpret: n.汽车等之底盘；（飞机的）起落架；炮底架
example: 单词 chassis 的例句||||The new parts may include the sheet metal, the transmission or the chassis. 新部件可能包括钢壳，变速器或底盘。||||Can chassis and whole-vehicle manufacturers co-exist peacefully? 底盘企业和整车企业能相安无事吗？

name: demure
example: 单词 demure 的例句||||She's very demure and sweet. 她非常娴静可爱。||||The luscious Miss Wharton gave me a demure but knowing smile. 性感迷人的沃顿小姐对我羞涩地会心一笑。

name: diminution
example: 单词 diminution 的例句||||They hope for a small diminution in taxes. 他们希望捐税能稍有减少。||||He experienced no diminution of his physical strength. 他并未感觉体力衰落。

name: disabuse
example: 单词 disabuse 的例句||||Let me disabuse of that foolish prejudices. 让我消除那个愚蠢的偏见。||||If you think I'm going to lend you money, I must disabuse you of that wrong idea. 你若认为我会借钱给你，我倒要劝你打消那念头。

name: doggerel
example: 单词 doggerel 的例句||||The doggerel doesn't filiate itself. 这首打油诗没有标明作者是谁。|||| He styled his poem doggerel. 他把他的这首诗歌叫做打油诗。

name: dolorous
example: 单词 dolorous 的例句||||With a broken-hearted smile, he lifted a pair of dolorous eyes. 带著伤心的微笑，他抬起了一双痛苦的眼睛。||||Perhaps love is a dolorous fairy tale. 也许爱情是一部忧伤的童话。

name: encomium
example: 单词 encomium 的例句||||He pronounced a splendid encomium upon her in the forum. 他在广场上为她作了华丽的赞颂。||||We hear only encomiums to it. 我们只听到对它的溢美之词。

name: excision
example: 单词 excision 的例句||||The excision of the clause has been decided. 已经决定删除这个条款。||||Complete excision is a curative treatment. 完全切除是唯一有效的治疗方式。

name: excoriate
example: 单词 excoriate 的例句||||He proceeded to excoriate me in front of the nurses. 他开始在护士面前痛斥我。||||His palms were excoriated by the hard labor of shoveling. 他的手掌因干挖土的活儿而磨破了皮。

name: execrate
interpret: vt. 诅咒；憎恶；痛骂 vi. 诅咒
example: 单词 execrate 的例句||||Others execrate it. 有些人痛恨它。||||I execrate people who deceive and tell lies. 我憎恶那些欺骗和说谎的人。

name: flippancy
example: 单词 flippancy 的例句||||His flippancy makes it difficult to have a decent conversation with him. 他玩世不恭，很难正经地和他交谈。||||The flippancy of your answer peeved me. 你轻率的回答令我懊恼。

name: gouge
interpret: vt.凿；挖出；n.半圆凿；凿孔；欺诈
example: 单词 gouge 的例句||||To make a Halloween lantern, you first have to gouge out the inside of the pumpkin. 要做一个万圣节灯笼，你先得挖空这个南瓜。||||In the Middle Ages, a favourite punishment was to gouge out a prisoner's eyes. 在中世纪，惩罚犯人最常用的办法是剜眼睛。

name: grandiloquent
example: 单词 grandiloquent 的例句||||He preferred, in his grandiloquent way, to call a spade a spade. 他喜欢夸夸其谈地谈出事实的真相来。||||He was a performer who loved making grandiloquent gesture. 他是一个喜欢打夸张手势的演员。

name: furor
example: 单词 furor 的例句||||His choice of words created quite a furor. 他的措辞引起了相当大的轰动。||||The half hour lecture caused an enormous furor. 那半小时的演讲引起了极大的轰动。

name: draconian
interpret: adj.严苛的；苛刻的；严酷的；龙一样的
example: 单词 draconian 的例句||||You can't expect the people to obey such draconian regulations. 你不能指望人民服从如此严苛的规定。||||The city needs a draconian way of dealing with robbers. 这个城市需要一个严苛的办法来对付强盗。

name: ingratitude
example: 单词 ingratitude 的例句||||Tim's parents were rather hurt by his ingratitude. 蒂姆的父母对他的忘恩负义很痛心。||||His friends were shocked by his ingratitude to his parents. 他对父母不孝，令他的朋友们大为吃惊。

name: sobriquet
example: 单词 sobriquet 的例句||||In Paris he was rewarded with the sobriquet of an "ultra-liberal". 在巴黎，他被冠以“超自由主义者”的绰号。||||Andrew Jackson was known by the sobriquet "Old Hickory. " 安德鲁·杰克生以其绰号“老山胡桃”而知名。

name: incognito
interpret: adv.匿名地；n.隐姓埋名；adj.化装的，用假名的，隐匿姓名身份的
example: 单词 incognito 的例句||||He preferred to remain incognito. 他更喜欢继续隐姓埋名下去。||||He didn't want to be recognized, so he travelled incognito. 他不想被人认出，所以出行时隐瞒身分。

name: protean
interpret: adj.反复无常的；变化自如的
example: 单词 protean 的例句||||Sri Lanka is a protean and wonderful paradise. 斯里兰卡是一个千变万化和精彩万分的人间天堂。||||He is a protean stylist who can move from blues to ballads and grand symphony. 他风格多变，从布鲁斯、乡村音乐到雄壮的交响乐都能驾驭。

name: piazza
example: 单词 piazza 的例句||||Siena's main piazza was one of the sights of Italy. 锡耶纳的主要广场是意大利的名胜之一。||||They walked out of the cafeteria, and across the piazza. 他们走出自助餐厅，穿过广场。

name: proboscis
example: 单词 proboscis 的例句||||Its proboscis has got stuck to a lot of pollen. 它的喙上粘了很多花粉。|||| It hovers in front of the flower, using its proboscis to look for nectar. 它在兰花前面飞来飞去，用喙寻找花蜜.

name: suppliant
example: 单词 suppliant 的例句||||He asked for help in a suppliant attitude. 他以恳求的态度要我帮忙。||||He knelt as a suppliant at the altar. 他跪在祭坛前祈祷。

name: provenance
example: 单词 provenance 的例句||||Kato was fully aware of the provenance of these treasures. 加藤完全清楚这些珍宝的来源。||||This plant's provenance is Asia. 这种植物原产于亚洲。

name: condign
example: 单词 condign 的例句||||The public approved the condign punishment. 公众一致称赞这个罪判得很恰当。||||Chinese didn’t obtain the equal position and condign respect. 中方并没有取得平等的地位和应有的尊重。

name: dour
interpret: adj.冷酷的，严厉的；（岩石）嶙峋的；顽强不屈
example: 单词 dour 的例句||||They were exposed to dour resistance. 他们遭受到顽强的抵抗。||||She always pretends to be dour, in fact, she's not. 她总表现的不爱讲话，事实却相反。

name: conjugal
example: 单词 conjugal 的例句||||Conjugal visits are banned, so marriages break down. 配偶访问是禁止的，罪犯的婚姻也因此破裂。||||Conjugal fate is something delicate. 缘分，其实是一种微妙的东西。

name: expiate
interpret: vt. 赎罪；补偿 vi. 赎罪；补偿
example: 单词 expiate 的例句||||He tried to expiate his crimes by giving money to the church. 他以捐款给教会来赎罪。||||It seemed that Alice was expiating her father's sins with her charity work. 似乎艾丽斯正在通过自己的慈善工作来弥补父亲的罪过。

name: coruscate
example: 单词 coruscate 的例句||||What kind of mood can make person's mind coruscate? 什么样心情可以让人精神焕发？||||The electric car is your best choice, bring your life coruscate. 这辆电动车是您最好的选择，领您的生活焕发光彩。

name: possessed
example: 单词 possessed 的例句||||He flew out of the room like a man possessed. 他像着了魔似地猛然冲出房门。||||He behaved like someone possessed. 他行为举止像是魔怔了。

name: skittish
example: 单词 skittish 的例句||||She gets very skittish when her boy-friend is around. 她男朋友在场时，她就显得格外轻佻。||||I won't have my son associating with skittish girls. 我不准我的儿子与轻佻的女孩交往。

name: somnolent
interpret: adj.想睡的，催眠的；adv.瞌睡地；昏昏欲睡地；使人瞌睡地
example: 单词 somnolent 的例句||||The noise of the stream had a pleasantly somnolent effect. 小河潺潺的流水声有宜人的催眠效果。||||The sedative makes people very somnolent. 这种镇静剂会让人瞌睡。

name: protuberant
example: 单词 protuberant 的例句||||The boy tripped over a protuberant rock. 那个男孩被突起的岩石绊了一下。||||He has a high-beaked nose and large protuberant eyes. 他有着高鼻梁和又大又凸出的眼睛

name: sophomoric
interpret: adj.一知半解的；大学或四年制中学的二年级的
example: 单词 sophomoric 的例句||||Do you really believe that sophomoric argument? 你当真相信那种幼稚可笑的论点吗？||||As a sophomoric student, it's very happy for me to receive invitation. 作为一个二年级的学生，能收到邀请，我自然感到特别开心。

name: prurient
example: 单词 prurient 的例句||||She showed a prurient interest in the details of the rape case. 她对那强奸案的细节津津乐道。||||We read the gossip written about them with prurient interest. 我们翻看他们的八卦时带着不洁的想法。

name: mite
example: 单词 mite 的例句||||The poor mite was so ill. 可怜的孩子病得这么重。||||He is a mite taller than I. 他比我高一点点。

name: mien
example: 单词 mien 的例句||||He was a Vietnam veteran with a haunted mien. 他是个越战老兵，举止总有些惶然。||||It was impossible to tell from his mien whether he was offended. 从他的神态中难以看出他是否生气了。

name: minatory
example: 单词 minatory 的例句||||How to eliminate this kind of harmful information's "content minatory"?  如何消除这种有害信息的“内容威胁”?||||This shows, rectum cancer will increasingly become a main cancer threatening people's health. 由此可见，直肠癌将日益成为威胁人民健康的一种主要癌肿。

name: minion
example: 单词 minion 的例句||||At worst this is a cheap trick conducted by some monoric minion. 这最多也不过是一批低能的小人物自己干的无聊把戏而已。||||She delegated the job to one of her minions. 她把这份工作委派给她的一个手下。

name: misanthrope
example: 单词 misanthrope 的例句||||After 1968, Elvis had become an epitome of a misanthrope, a weak and regress image of the pop music world. 1968年之后, “猫王”被看作流行音乐界愤世嫉俗、软弱以及倒退现象的缩影。||||You'd have to be some kind of cynic or misanthrope to object to such a laudable goal. 你得有点愤世嫉俗或厌恶人类才会反对这个值得赞赏的目标。

name: muggy
interpret: adj.闷热的；adv.（天气）闷热而潮湿地；n.（天气）闷热而潮湿
example: 单词 muggy 的例句||||We may expect muggy weather when the rainy season begins. 雨季开始时，我们预料有闷热的天气。||||It was muggy and overcast. 天气闷热潮湿，而且天色阴沉。

name: platonic
example: 单词 platonic 的例句||||Their friendship is based on platonic love. 他们的友情是基于柏拉图式的爱情。||||Can Platonic love really exist in real life? 柏拉图式的爱情，在现实世界里到底可能吗?

name: persiflage
example: 单词 persiflage 的例句||||When he spoke of murder, suicide, venereal disease, amputated limbs and altered faces, it was with a faint air of persiflage. 他谈到杀人、自杀、花柳病、断肢、换脸型的时候，隐隐有一种揶揄的神情。||||The persiflage is not appropriate when we are discussing such serious problems. 当我们在讨论如此严肃的问题的时候，这种戏谑的言辞是不恰当的。

name: pedant
example: 单词 pedant 的例句||||He's a bit of a pedant. 这人有点迂。||||A man of talent is one thing, and a pedant another. 有才能的人和卖弄学问的人是不一样的。

name: pelf
example: 单词 pelf 的例句||||Let him disenslave himself from the pelf of the world. 让他从金钱束缚下解放自己。||||Pelf makes friends, adversity tries them. 富贵交友易，患难显真情。

name: philistine
interpret: n.庸俗的人；adj.市侩的，庸俗的
example: 单词 philistine 的例句||||I believe he seriously thinks me an awful Philistine. 我相信，他真的认为我是个不可救药的庸人。||||Do you know what a philistine is, jim? 吉姆，知道什么是庸俗吗?

name: potentate
example: 单词 potentate 的例句||||People rose up against the despotic rule of their potentate. 人们起来反抗君主的专制统治。||||I shall recline here like an oriental potentate. 我要像个东方君主一样躺在这.

name: portent
example: 单词 portent 的例句||||I see it as a portent of things to come. 我把它看作是将要到来的事物的前兆。||||As for her engagement with Adam, I would say the portents are gloomy. 至于她和亚当的婚约，我看兆头不妙。

name: pendulous
example: 单词 pendulous 的例句||||The oriole builds a pendulous nest. 金莺鸟筑一个悬垂的巢。||||Her lip grew pendulous as she aged. 由于老迈，她的嘴唇往下坠了。

name: penitent
example: 单词 penitent 的例句||||They all appeared very penitent, and begged hard for their lives. 他们一个个表示悔罪，苦苦地哀求饶命。||||She is deeply penitent. 她深感愧疚。

name: pillage
interpret: vi. 掠夺；抢劫 vt. 掠夺；抢劫；n.抢劫，掠夺；掠夺物
example: 单词 pillage 的例句||||The invading troops were guilty of rape and pillage. 侵略军犯了抢劫和强奸的罪。||||It was almost pillage. 这简直是一场洗劫。

name: perigee
example: 单词 perigee 的例句||||The Moon reaches its absolute perigee once a year. 月球每年有一次达到它的绝对近地点。||||Once the satellite reaches perigee, it will eject a small probe which enter the planet's atmosphere. 当人造卫星达到近地点时，就会发射一根小探针，这根探针将进入行星的大气层。

name: purgatory
interpret: n.炼狱；苦难；adj.净化的，清洗的
example: 单词 purgatory 的例句||||Every step of the last three miles was purgatory. 最后3英里时每一步都像是受罪。||||Marriage with peace is this world's paradise, with strife, this world's purgatory. 和谐的婚姻是尘世的乐园，不和谐的婚姻则是人生的炼狱。

name: promontory
example: 单词 promontory 的例句||||Genius is a promontory jutting out of the infinite. 天才是茫茫大地突出的岬角。||||On the map that promontory looks like a nose, naughtily turned up. 从地图上面，那个海角就像一只调皮地翘起来的鼻子。

name: purloin
interpret: vt. 偷窃 vi. 偷窃
example: 单词 purloin 的例句||||Each side purloins the other's private letters. 双方彼此都偷对方的私人信件。||||Xiao Chen insisted that he didn't purloin. 小陈坚称自己没有偷窃。

name: conclave
example: 单词 conclave 的例句||||Signore, I ask and I prey, that you break this conclave. 各位阁下，我请求，并祈祷，你们能停止这次秘密会议。||||I met my partner at that conclave and my life moved into a huge shift. 我就是在那次大会上遇到了我的伴侣的，而我的生活就转向了一个巨大的改变。

name: complaisance
example: 单词 complaisance 的例句||||She speaks with complaisance. 她说话彬彬有礼。||||His complaisance leaves a good impression on her. 他的彬彬有礼给她留下了深刻的印象。

name: contrived
interpret: adj.不自然的，做作的；虚构的
example: 单词 contrived 的例句||||There was nothing contrived or calculated about what he said. 他说的话里没有任何蓄意捏造的成分。||||The plot seems contrived. 情节看起来不真实。

name: cornucopia
example: 单词 cornucopia 的例句||||The book is a cornucopia of information. 书是知识的宝库。||||Our cornucopia is the human mind and heart. 我们富足是由于人类的智慧和热情。

name: conundrum
example: 单词 conundrum 的例句||||Let me give you some history about a conundrum. 让我给你们一些关于谜题的历史。||||Scientists had focused on two explanations to solve this conundrum. 科学家已锁定两种解释来解开这个难题。

name: corporeal
example: 单词 corporeal 的例句||||The body is the corporeal habitation of the soul. 身体为灵魂之有形寓所。||||He is very religious. Corporeal world has little interest for him. 他虔信宗教，对物质上的享受不感兴趣。

name: convalesce
example: 单词 convalesce 的例句||||She went to the seaside to convalesce after her stay in hospital. 她经过住院治疗后，前往海滨养病。||||After two weeks, I was allowed home, where I convalesced for three months. 两周之后，我获准回家，休养了3个月之后逐渐康复。

name: convergent
example: 单词 convergent 的例句||||A curved-inwards wall has a convergent effect on wall spray. 凹型壁面对碰壁喷雾有聚集作用。||||If a sequence is not convergent, it is divergent. 如果一个序列不收敛, 我们称它发散。

name: cosset
example: 单词 cosset 的例句||||Our kind of travel is definitely not suitable for people who expect to be cosseted. 我们的这种旅行绝对不适合那些想要受到百般呵护的人。||||I don't want to be treated like a cosseted movie queen. 我不愿意被人当作是个娇纵惯了的电影皇后。

name: coterminous
example: 单词 coterminous 的例句||||China and Thailand is coterminous. 中国和泰国是毗连的。||||For Marx, social class was determined by and coterminous with, economic class. 马克思认为社会阶级取决于经济阶级，并与经济阶级具有紧密联系。

name: cronyism
interpret: n.任人唯亲，对好朋友的偏袒
example: 单词 cronyism 的例句||||Many small town mayor and city official practice cronyism. 许多小镇的市长和大城市的官员都有任人唯亲的行为。||||Bringing business people into politics can also produce corruption and cronyism. 商人从政也容易带来腐败和任人唯亲。

name: cozen
interpret: vt. 瞒；欺骗 vi. 瞒；欺骗
example: 单词 cozen 的例句||||A clever lawyer can cozen the prisoner into an admission of guilt. 一个聪明的律师能施小计诱使囚犯承认有罪。||||Call me cousin, but cozen me not. 与我攀亲可以，但欺骗我可不行。

name: curdle
interpret: vi. 凝固 vt. 使凝结
example: 单词 curdle 的例句||||The sauce should not boil or the egg yolk will curdle. 调味汁不能煮沸，不然蛋黄会凝结的。||||The sight made my blood curdle. 那景象使我不寒而栗。

name: demotic
interpret: adj. 民众的，通俗的；n.（古埃及）通俗文字
example: 单词 demotic 的例句||||It is television's demotic style of language. 这是电视通俗的语言风格。||||The socioligist maintained that a demotic society would lower the nation's standards. 这个社会学家认为平民社会会降低国家的素质。

name: briskness
example: 单词 briskness 的例句||||A child who was flying a kite sensed it in terms of briskness. 一个孩子在放风筝时猛然感到的飞腾。||||Father open the window to let in the briskness of the morning air. 父亲打开窗户让早晨的清新空气进来。

name: baboon
example: 单词 baboon 的例句||||A baboon is a large monkey that lives in Africa. 狒狒是一种生活在非洲的大猴子。||||As long as the baboon holds on to what it wants, it's trapped. 只要狒狒紧抓住想要的东西不放手，它就会被牢牢困住。

name: colloquialism
example: 单词 colloquialism 的例句||||The writer aerateed his writing with a persuasive colloquialism. 作者用一种有说服力的口语体使他的文章显得生动。||||Her speech is informal and filled with colloquialism. 她的演讲是非正式的，很口语化。

name: condor
example: 单词 condor 的例句||||The condor soars above the mountain heights. 禿鹰翱翔于高山之上。||||A condor prepares to fly in Colombia. 一只兀鹰在哥伦比亚准备振翅高飞。

name: crustacean
example: 单词 crustacean 的例句||||The valuable seafood lobster is crustacean section. 名贵海珍品龙虾属甲壳科。||||The illustrious Cuvier did not perceive that a barnacle was a crustacean. 大名鼎鼎的居维叶也未看出藤壶是一种甲壳动物。

name: entrenched
interpret: adj.确立的，不容易改的(风俗习惯)
example: 单词 entrenched 的例句||||Television seems to be firmly entrenched as the number one medium for national advertising. 电视看来要在全国广告媒介中牢固地占据头等位置。||||If the enemy dares to attack us in these entrenched positions, we will make short work of them. 如果敌人胆敢进攻我们固守的阵地，我们就消灭他们。

name: twine
interpret: vt. 使缠绕；使交织；编饰 vi. 缠绕；搓；交织；编饰 n. 麻线；细绳；搓；合股线
example: 单词 twine 的例句||||He tied the parcel with twine. 他用细绳捆包裹。||||Their cardboard boxes were wrapped and tied neatly with waxed twine. 他们的纸板盒用蜡线扎得整整齐齐。

name: viscosity
example: 单词 viscosity 的例句||||The viscosity shows a rather pronounced variation with temperature. 温度对粘度的影响十分明显。||||The reciprocal of viscosity is known as fluidity. 粘度的反意就是流动性。

name: orientate
interpret: vi. 向东；定向 vt. 给...定位；使适应
example: 单词 orientate 的例句||||The explorer climbed a tree in order to orientate himself. 那位勘探者为了确定他所在的地点爬到了一颗树上。||||The mountaineers found it difficult to orientate themselves in the fog. 登山的人在浓雾中难以确定自己的方位。

name: periscope
example: 单词 periscope 的例句||||The captain aligned the periscope on the bearing. 船长使潜望镜对准方位。||||Now, peering through the periscope he remarkes in businesslike tones. 现在，他一面从潜望镜里观察，一面用精干踏实的口吻说话。

name: piecemeal
interpret: adj.零碎的；n.片，块；adv.逐渐地；v.弄成碎块
example: 单词 piecemeal 的例句||||A lack of narrative drive leaves the reader with piecemeal vignettes. 叙述缺乏吸引力，读者读到的只是一些支离破碎的片段。||||Let's settle the matter at one stroke, not piecemeal. 把这事一气儿解决了吧，别零敲碎打了。

name: planetarium
example: 单词 planetarium 的例句||||The planetarium staff also prepared talks for radio broadcast. 天文馆的工作人员还要准备讲稿给电台广播。||||It landed in a shallow basin fifty yards from the planetarium. 它降落在离天文馆五十码处的一个浅盆地中。

name: exasperation
example: 单词 exasperation 的例句||||He snorted with exasperation. 他愤怒地哼了一声。||||She rolled her eyes in sheer exasperation. 她气急败坏地转动着眼珠。

name: infringement
example: 单词 infringement 的例句||||Infringement of this regulation would automatically rule you out of the championship. 违背这一规则会被自动取消参加锦标赛的资格。||||The committee ruled that the US ban constituted an infringement of free trade. 委员会裁定美国的禁令对自由贸易构成了侵犯

name: procurement
example: 单词 procurement 的例句||||He is in charge of the procurement of materials. 他负责物资的采购。||||More and more, human food procurement came to have a dominant effect on their evolution. 人类获取食物愈来愈显著地影响到人类的进化。

name: scaly
example: 单词 scaly 的例句||||Reptiles possess a scaly, dry skin. 爬行类具有覆盖着鳞片的干燥皮肤。||||The iron pipe is scaly with rust. 铁管子因为生锈一片片剥落了。

name: smuggling
example: 单词 smuggling 的例句||||Some claimed that the docker's union fronted for the smuggling ring. 某些人声称码头工人工会是走私集团的掩护所。||||The evidence pointed to the existence of an international smuggling network. 证据表明很可能有一个国际走私网络存在。

name: vouch
interpret: vt. 担保；证明；传出庭作证 vi. 保证；证明；确定
example: 单词 vouch 的例句||||They asked whether I was prepared to vouch for him. 他们问我是否愿意为他作担保。||||I can vouch for the fact that he is a good worker. 我保证他是好员工。

name: espy
example: 单词 espy 的例句||||Where love fails, we espy all faults. 一旦失恋，缺点易见。||||Here, from a window, did Guinevere espy a knight standing in a woodman's cart. 吉尼维尔是从这里透过窗户看到了站在樵夫车上的骑士。

name: presentiment
example: 单词 presentiment 的例句||||He had a presentiment of disaster. 他预感会有灾难降临。||||I have a presentiment that something bad will happen. 我有某种不祥事要发生的预感。

name: shambles
example: 单词 shambles 的例句||||My room is a shambles. 我房间里乱七八糟。||||The fighting reduced the city to a shambles. 这场战斗使这座城市成了一片废墟。

name: prank
interpret: n.开玩笑，恶作剧；v.装饰；打扮；炫耀自己
example: 单词 prank 的例句||||It was thought that the fire alarm had been set off as a prank. 人们认为火警报警器响是个恶作剧。||||The dean was ranking the boys for pulling the prank. 系主任正在惩罚那些恶作剧的男学生。

name: spectral
example: 单词 spectral 的例句||||At times he seems rather ordinary. At other times ethereal, perhaps even spectral. 有时他好像很正常，有时又难以捉摸，甚至像个幽灵。||||She is compelling, spectral fascinating, an unforgettably unique performer. 她极具吸引力，清幽如鬼魅，令人着迷，令人难忘，是个独具特色的演员。

name: poltroon
example: 单词 poltroon 的例句||||You are a poltroon to abuse your strength. 你是一个滥用武力的懦夫。||||He is more poltroon than cautious. 与其说他谨慎，不如说他是怯懦。

name: articulation
interpret: n.（清楚的）发音；清晰度，咬合
example: 单词 articulation 的例句||||His articulation is poor. 他发音不清楚。||||She spoke with a lazy articulation. 她说话慢吞吞的。

name: suave
example: 单词 suave 的例句||||He is a suave, cool and cultured man. 他是个世故、冷静、有教养的人。||||I had difficulty answering his suave questions. 我难以回答他的一些彬彬有礼的提问。

name: predilection
example: 单词 predilection 的例句||||He has a predilection for rich food. 他偏好油腻的食物。||||Charles has always had a predilection for red-haired women. 查尔斯对红头发女人一直有偏爱。

name: profligate
interpret: adj.行为不检的；n.放荡的人，浪子，肆意挥霍者
example: 单词 profligate 的例句||||This young man had all the inclination to be a profligate of the first water. 这个青年完全有可能成为十足的浪子。||||Similarly Americans have been profligate in the handling of mineral resources. 同样的，美国在处理矿产资源方面亦多浪费。

name: restitution
example: 单词 restitution 的例句||||It's only fair that those who do the damage should make restitution. 损坏东西的人应负责赔偿，这是再公平不过的了。||||The victims are demanding full restitution. 受害人要求全额赔偿。

name: reprehensible
example: 单词 reprehensible 的例句||||Lying is not seen as being morally reprehensible in any strong way. 人们并不把撒谎当作一件应该大加谴责的事儿。||||It was reprehensible of him to be so disloyal. 他如此不忠，应受谴责。

name: reprieve
interpret: n.暂缓执行（死刑）；v.缓期执行；给…带来缓解
example: 单词 reprieve 的例句||||He was saved from the gallows by a lastminute reprieve. 最后一刻的缓刑令把他从绞架上解救了下来。||||The railway line, due for closure, has been granted a six-month reprieve. 本应停运的铁路线获准多运行6个月。

name: retinue
example: 单词 retinue 的例句||||The duchess arrived, surrounded by her retinue of servants. 公爵夫人在大批随从人马的簇拥下到达了。||||The king's retinue accompanied him on the journey. 国王的侍从在旅途上陪伴着他。

name: serendipity
interpret: n.偶然发现物品之才能；意外新发现
example: 单词 serendipity 的例句||||"It was serendipity all the way, " he says. 用他的话说是“一直都很走运”。||||Some of the best effects in my garden have been the result of serendipity. 我园子里最珍贵的几件物品是机缘巧合之下意外所得。

name: risible
example: 单词 risible 的例句||||The entire proposal is risible. 这个建议完全是荒唐可笑的。||||He drew a risible picture on the wall. 他在墙上画了一张滑稽的画。

name: specious
interpret: adj.似是而非的；adv.似是而非地
example: 单词 specious 的例句||||Such talk is actually specious and groundless. 这些话实际上毫无根据，似是而非的。||||It is unlikely that the Duke was convinced by such specious arguments. 公爵不太可能相信这种似是而非的论点。

name: stilted
example: 单词 stilted 的例句||||All too soon the stilted conversation ran out. 很快这种做作的交谈就结束了。||||His delivery was stilted and occasionally stumbling. 他的发言很生硬，有时还打结巴。

name: sunder
interpret: vt. 切开；切断 vi. 分离；断开；n.分离，分开
example: 单词 sunder 的例句||||Lightning tore the tree in sunder. 闪电把树劈成两半。||||Nothing can sunder our friendship. 什么也不能破坏我们的友谊。

name: supplicate
interpret: vt. 恳求，哀求；恳请 vi. 哀求；恳请；祈求；adv.祈求地，哀求地，恳求地
example: 单词 supplicate 的例句||||She supplicated the judge for protection. 她恳求法官保护。||||I do not supplicate to women because they find it unattractive. 我不会向女人恳求，因为那吸引不了她们。

name: toady
interpret: vi. 谄媚 vt. 谄媚 n. 谄媚者
example: 单词 toady 的例句||||He flung it in my teeth that I was a toady. 他责备我是个马屁精。||||Arrogance has no defense against a toady. 傲慢防不了谄媚者。

name: sycophantic
example: 单词 sycophantic 的例句||||Qinhui was a notorious sycophantic official in the Song dynasty, and was spurned by later generations. 秦桧是宋代著名的佞臣，受尽后人的唾骂。||||We heard the sound of sycophantic laughter. 我们听到了谄媚的笑声。

name: truncate
example: 单词 truncate 的例句||||Sorry, the text is too long to edit. Truncate it to 255 characters?  对不起，文本太长了，无法进行编辑。将其截断到255个字符吗？||||Do you want to truncate the transaction log?  是否要截断事务日志？

name: vituperative
example: 单词 vituperative 的例句||||He is often the victim of vituperative remarks concerning his wealth. 他经常因为富有而受到辱骂。||||I was really taken aback by their vituperative animosity toward the Soviet Union. 他们对苏联如此深恶痛绝，着实令我吃惊。

name: volition
example: 单词 volition 的例句||||We like to think that everything we do and everything we think is a product of our volition. 我们常常认为我们所做和所想的一切都出自自己的意愿。||||Makin said Mr Coombes had gone to the police of his own volition. 梅金说库姆斯先生是主动去投案的。

name: votary
interpret: n.崇拜者；爱好者；adj.誓约的，立誓任圣职的
example: 单词 votary 的例句||||He was a votary of golf. 他是高尔夫球忠实信徒。||||Akshay Babu, who had made the passion in English literature living to us, was himself a votary of the emotional life. 阿卡什先生，这位使我们逼真地感到英国文学强烈情感的人，他自己就是一个性情中人。

name: extemporize
interpret: vi. 即兴演奏或演说；临时凑合 vt. 即兴演奏或演说；当场作成
example: 单词 extemporize 的例句||||He had to extemporize because he had forgotten to bring his notes. 他因为忘了带讲稿，只好即席发言。||||Certain performers are funnier when they extemporize. 有些演员即兴表演时更有趣。

name: insularity
interpret: n.心胸狭窄；孤立；偏狭；岛国根性
example: 单词 insularity 的例句||||But at least they have started to break out of their old insularity. 但是他们至少已经开始打破过去孤立保守的心态。||||It was a typical case of British chauvinism and insularity. 这是典型的英国沙文主义和偏狭心理的事例。

name: posit
example: 单词 posit 的例句||||If she needs salvation, she will posit a savior. 如果她需要救助，她就会设想一个救助者。||||Other historians posit that she died of old age around 550 BC. 别的史学家则认为她一直活到公元前550年左右才寿终正寝。

name: pout
interpret: n. 撅嘴；生气 vt. 撅嘴 vi. 撅嘴
example: 单词 pout 的例句||||She looked at her lover with a pretentious pout. 她看着恋人，故作不悦地撅着嘴。||||He whined and pouted when he did not get what he wanted. 他要是没得到想要的东西就会发牢骚、撅嘴。

name: recessive
interpret: adj.退行的，逆行的，后退的，隐性的
example: 单词 recessive 的例句||||Blue eyes are recessive and brown eyes are dominant. 蓝眼睛是隐性的；而褐色眼睛是显性的。||||Sickle-cell anaemia is passed on through a recessive gene. 镰状细胞贫血通过隐性基因遗传给后代。

name: pulverize
example: 单词 pulverize 的例句||||A armory had been bombed the night before and a residential area not far away had been pulverized. 前天晚上，一家兵工厂被炸, 不远处的居民区也被夷为平地。||||He is set to pulverise his two opponents in the race for the presidency. 他决心在总统竞选中彻底击垮他的两个对手。

name: resurgence
example: 单词 resurgence 的例句||||A resurgence of grief swept over Nim. 悲痛又涌上了尼姆的心头。||||Police say drugs traffickers are behind the resurgence of violence. 警方说毒贩是暴力活动重新抬头的罪魁祸首。

name: shale
example: 单词 shale 的例句||||We can extract oil from shale. 我们可以从页岩中提取石油。||||Most of the rock in this mountain is shale. 这座山上大部分的岩石都是页岩。

name: spat
interpret: n.口角，掌击；v.发出呼噜呼噜声
example: 单词 spat 的例句||||Her parents always have spats. 她的父母经常有些小的口角。||||There is only a spat between the brother and sister. 那只是兄妹间的小吵小闹。

name: subpoena
example: 单词 subpoena 的例句||||He was brought up to court with a subpoena. 他接到传讯，来到法庭上。||||Select committees have the power to subpoena witnesses. 特别委员会有权传唤证人。

name: tourniquet
example: 单词 tourniquet 的例句||||Twist the tourniquet tighter. 把止血带扎紧点。||||The tourniquet should occlude venous and lymphatic return. 止血带应阻断静脉及淋巴回流。

name: congruity
example: 单词 congruity 的例句||||Congruity is the mother of love. 和谐是爱情之母。||||There is a definite congruity in the candidates' approach to the tax problem. 候选人在对待税收问题的态度上有着明确的共同之处。

name: discourteous
example: 单词 discourteous 的例句||||I was offended by his discourteous reply. 他无礼的回答使我很生气。||||It was discourteous of you to arrive late. 你迟到了，真没礼貌。

name: cuttlefish
example: 单词 cuttlefish 的例句||||I have no idea about how to prepare those cuttlefish and lobsters. 我对如何烹调那些乌贼和龙虾毫无概念。||||The cuttlefish spurts out dark ink when it is in danger. 乌鲗遇到危险的时候会喷出黑色液体。

name: cypress
example: 单词 cypress 的例句||||The towering pine and cypress defy frost and snow. 松柏参天傲霜雪。||||The pine and the cypress remain green all the year round. 苍松翠柏，常绿不凋。

name: douse
interpret: vt. 插入水中；弄湿；弄熄；急速收帆；脱掉（衣鞋等） vi. 浸泡 n. 泼洒
example: 单词 douse 的例句||||Men came with buckets of water and began to douse the flames. 人们提来一桶桶水灭火。||||He doused the flames with a fire extinguisher. 他用灭火器把火焰扑灭。

name: goblet
example: 单词 goblet 的例句||||He poured some wine into the goblet. 他向高脚酒杯里倒了一些葡萄酒。||||He swirled the brandy around in the huge goblet. 他摇晃着高脚大玻璃杯使里面的白兰地酒旋动起来。

name: gore
interpret: n.凝血，血污；v.（动物）用角撞伤，用牙刺破；缝以补裆；顶
example: 单词 gore 的例句||||The fox lay dying in a pool of gore. 狐狸倒在血泊中奄奄一息。||||Carruthers had been gored by a rhinoceros. 卡拉瑟斯被犀牛顶伤了。

name: hyena
example: 单词 hyena 的例句||||African hyena noted for its distinctive howl. 非洲鬣狗，以其特别的嚎叫而闻名。||||The hyena's public image is not aided by its ridiculous appearance. 鬣狗滑稽的外表无助于改善它在公众心中的形象。

name: inanity
example: 单词 inanity 的例句||||Their statement was a downright inanity. 他们的声明是彻头彻尾的废话。||||I laugh all alone when I'm complete inanity. 十分无聊时，我就独自大笑。

name: commendable
example: 单词 commendable 的例句||||The government's action here is highly commendable. 政府这样的行动值得高度赞扬。||||Such carping is not commendable. 这样吹毛求疵真不大好。

name: irreproachable
example: 单词 irreproachable 的例句||||It emerged that his past behavior was far from irreproachable. 事实表明，他过去的行为绝非无可非议。||||She welcomed her unexpected visitor with irreproachable politeness. 她以无可指责的礼仪接待了不速之客。

name: iris
example: 单词 iris 的例句||||The opening of the iris is called the pupil. 虹膜的开口处叫做瞳孔。||||This incredible human eye, complete with retina and iris, can be found in the Maldives. 又是在马尔代夫，有这样一只难以置信的眼睛，连视网膜和虹膜都刻画齐全了。

name: lessee
example: 单词 lessee 的例句||||The lessor can evict the lessee for failure to pay rent. 出租人可驱逐不付租金的承租人。||||The lessee will be asked to fill in a leasing application. 租赁人要求填写一张租赁申请。

name: providence
interpret: n.深谋远虑，天道，天意；远见；节约；上帝
example: 单词 providence 的例句||||It is tempting Providence to go in that old boat. 乘那艘旧船前往是冒大险。||||To act as you have done is to fly in the face of Providence. 照你的所作所为那样去行事，是违背上帝的意志的。

name: skunk
interpret: n.臭鼬，黄鼠狼；v.使惨败，使得零分；烂醉如泥
example: 单词 skunk 的例句||||That was a rotten thing to do, you skunk! 那种事做得太缺德了，你这卑鄙的家伙！||||The skunk gives off an unpleasant smell when attacked. 受到攻击时臭鼬会发出一种难闻的气味。

name: stuntman
example: 单词 stuntman 的例句||||The stuntman will double for the main actor during the action scenes. 一些动作场景中，特技演员代替主演。||||The stuntman flew the aircraft upside-down within a hair's breadth of the rooftops. 那位做电影演员替身的杂技演员驾驶着飞机翻过来又倒过去，差一点撞着平顶房的屋顶。

name: tuxedo
example: 单词 tuxedo 的例句||||Well, you have your own tuxedo. 噢，你有自己的燕尾服。||||Have I told you how amazing you look in this tuxedo? 我告诉过你穿这件燕尾服看起来很棒吗？

name: uptight
example: 单词 uptight 的例句||||He's feeling a bit uptight about his exam tomorrow. 他因明天的考试而感到有点紧张。||||Try to laugh at it instead of getting uptight. 试着一笑了之，不要紧张。

name: flamingo
example: 单词 flamingo 的例句||||This is the only species of flamingo in the region, easily recognized by its pink plumage. 这是那个地区唯一一种火烈鸟，很容易凭粉红色的羽毛辨认出来。||||In my family, I am flamingo in the flock of pigeons. 在家里，我就像一只被困在鸽笼里的火烈鸟。

name: geologic
example: 单词 geologic 的例句||||The Red Sea is a geologic continuation of the valley. 红海就是一个峡谷在地质上的继续发展。||||Delineation of channels is the first step of geologic evaluation. 勾划河道的轮廓是地质解译的第一步。

name: hawthorn
example: 单词 hawthorn 的例句||||A cuckoo began calling from a hawthorn tree. 一只布谷鸟开始在一株山楂树里咕咕地呼叫。||||Much of the track had become overgrown with hawthorn. 小路上很多地方都长满了山楂树。

name: puma
example: 单词 puma 的例句||||The police and the volunteers combed the forest for the lost puma from the zoo. 警察和志愿者们在森林里到处寻找动物园丟失的美洲狮。||||A businessman saw the puma up a tree on his fishing trip. 一位商人去钓鱼，看见那只美洲狮在树上。

name: crevasse
interpret: n. 裂缝，破口；v.使有裂缝
example: 单词 crevasse 的例句||||The deep crevasse yawned at their feet. 他们脚下的冰川有一道深深的裂缝。||||He fell down a crevasse. 他从裂缝处摔了下来。

name: dictatorial
example: 单词 dictatorial 的例句||||Her father is very dictatorial. 她父亲很专横。||||For years the nation had been under the heel of a dictatorial regime. 多年来这个国家一直在独裁政权的铁蹄下。

name: battered
example: 单词 battered 的例句||||He drove up in a battered old car. 他开着一辆又老又破的旧车。||||The world was brutally battered but it survived. 这个世界遭受了惨重的创伤，但它还是生存下来了。

name: saviour
example: 单词 saviour 的例句||||I saw myself as the saviour of my country. 我幻想自己为国家的救星。||||The people clearly saw her as their saviour. 人们显然把她看成了救星。

name: alpine
example: 单词 alpine 的例句||||Alpine flowers are abundant there. 那里有很多高山地带的花。||||Its main attractions are alpine lakes and waterfalls . 它以高山湖泊和瀑布群为主要特色。

name: agitator
example: 单词 agitator 的例句||||Hitler's just a self-educated street agitator. 希特勒无非是个自学出身的街头煽动家罢了。||||Mona had watched him grow into an arrogant political agitator. 莫娜看着他成长为一个高傲的政治鼓动家。

name: carousel
example: 单词 carousel 的例句||||Riding on a carousel makes you feel dizzy. 乘旋转木马使你头晕。||||We looked like a bunch of awkward kids riding a slow-moving carousel. 我们看起来就像一群骑在旋转木马上的笨拙的孩子。

name: impeachment
example: 单词 impeachment 的例句||||Impeachment is considered a drastic measure in the United States. 在美国，弹劾被视为一种非常激烈的措施。||||The verdict resulting from his impeachment destroyed his political career. 他遭弹劾后得到的判决毁了他的政治生涯。

name: clove
example: 单词 clove 的例句||||If tired, smell a whiff of clove oil and it will wake you up. 如果疲倦，闻上一点丁香油将令人清醒。||||A sweet-smell comes from roses and clove trees. 丁香与玫瑰的香味扑鼻而来。

name: saccharine
example: 单词 saccharine 的例句||||She smiled with saccharine sweetness. 她的笑里只有虚情假意的甜蜜。||||I found the film far too saccharine. 我觉得这部电影太缠绵了。

name: atheistic
example: 单词 atheistic 的例句||||She has the gift of the gab. 她口才很好。||||With his gift of gab, he should make an excellent politician. 以其雄辩之才，他应该可以成为出色的政治家。

name: gab
interpret: vi.空谈，唠叨，瞎扯；n.饶舌，多嘴，爱说话
example: 单词 gab 的例句||||The young man had got the gift of gab. 那个年轻小贩能说会道。||||She has the gift of the gab. 她口才很好。

name: oafish
example: 单词 oafish 的例句||||The bodyguards, as usual, were brave but oafish. 这些保镖照旧勇气可嘉但鲁钝无礼。||||But we will never see that glory if we till the soil like oafish farm hands. 但是要是我们象白痴农奴那样去耕地，我们永远也看不到这样的荣耀！

name: backbite
interpret: vi. 背后中伤 vt. 背后诽谤 n. 背后诽谤
example: 单词 backbite 的例句||||His classmates do not enjoy his company because he always backbite others. 他的同学不喜欢和他在一起，因为他老是在背后诽谤别人。||||I can't stand it when people backbite. 我无法容忍别人背后诽谤。

name: calipers
example: 单词 calipers 的例句||||He picked up the calipers and gauged carefully. 他拿起卡钳仔细测量。||||The carpenter gauged the dowel with calipers. 那木匠用卡钳估量暗榫。

name: bard
example: 单词 bard 的例句||||I'll use my bard song to help you concentrate! 我会用我的吟游诗人歌曲帮你集中精神！||||I find him, the wandering grey bard. 我发现了正在徘徊的衰老游唱诗人。

name: barefaced
example: 单词 barefaced 的例句||||It's barefaced robbery asking such a high price for that old bicycle! 那辆旧自行车要价如此之高真是无耻的敲诈。||||What barefaced cheek! 真是厚颜无耻！

name: deadpan
example: 单词 deadpan 的例句||||Some people don't catch his deadpan humor, that makes it even funnier. 有些人不能了解他那种无表情的幽默，因此更有趣。||||She put the letter on the desk in front of me, her face deadpan, not a flicker of a smile. 她把那封信放在我面前的桌子上，故意一脸严肃，没有一丝的笑容。

name: debouch
interpret: vi. （河川向广阔处）流出；进出于（广阔地方） vt. 使出来；使流注
example: 单词 debouch 的例句||||The regiments debouched from the valley. 这个团从山谷中走了出来。||||The stream debouches into the estuary. 这条河流入河口湾。

name: debrief
example: 单词 debrief 的例句||||The men have been debriefed by British and Saudi officials. 英国和沙特阿拉伯的官员听取了他们的情况汇报。||||He went to Rio after the CIA had debriefed him. 他向中央情报局汇报完任务执行情况后就去了里约热内卢。

name: declamation
example: 单词 declamation 的例句||||Declamation is a traditional Chinese teaching method. 诵读教学是我国传统的语文教学方法。||||Were you present at the declamation contest of Freshmen? 大一的朗诵比赛你参加了没有？

name: acolyte
example: 单词 acolyte 的例句||||To his acolytes, he is known simply as "the Boss". 他被手下人简称为“老板”。||||Richard Brome, an acolyte of Ben Jonson's, wrote "The Jovial Crew" in 1641. 本•琼森的仆人理查德•布罗姆在1641年写了《一伙快活人》。

name: agglomerate
interpret: vt.凝聚，结块；n.团块；集块岩；（杂乱的）堆积；
example: 单词 agglomerate 的例句||||Similarly charged colloidal particles cannot come close enough together to agglomerate into larger particles. 带相同电荷的胶粒不能紧密靠近，它们不能聚集成较大的颗粒。||||Moreover, industries tend to agglomerate rather than to disperse. 此外，产业倾向于聚集而不是分散化。

name: agog
interpret: adj.兴奋的，有强烈兴趣的； adv.渴望地
example: 单词 agog 的例句||||The children were all agog to hear the story. 孩子们都渴望着要听这个故事。||||The city was agog with rumors last night that the two had been executed. 那两人已被处决的传言昨晚搞得全城沸沸扬扬。

name: alabaster
interpret: adj.雪白的；n.雪花石膏；条纹大理石
example: 单词 alabaster 的例句||||The floor was marble tile, and the columns alabaster. 地板是由大理石铺成的，柱子则是雪花石膏打造而成。||||Her skin was like alabaster. 她的皮肤光洁雪白。

name: addendum
example: 单词 addendum 的例句||||This is an addendum to the book. 这是本书的附录。||||Six parts and one addendum are separated in the paper. 论文由六章和一个附录组成。

name: alcove
example: 单词 alcove 的例句||||The bookcase fits neatly into the alcove. 书架正好放得进壁凹。||||In the alcoves on either side of the stove were bookshelves. 火炉两边的凹室里是书架。

name: aerate

example: 单词 gazetteer 的例句||||Any atlas, containing many pages of maps, normally includes an index, called a gazetteer. 任何载有多幅地图的地图集，一般都附有一份地名索引。||||The entire "Geographia" is the first atlas and gazetteer. 全部《地理学》可说是第一本地图集和地名辞典。

name: gluttonous
example: 单词 gluttonous 的例句||||He is a gluttonous and lazy guy. 他是个好吃懒做之徒。||||He is a selfish, gluttonous and lazy person. 他是一个自私，贪婪又懒惰的人。

name: illiberal
example: 单词 illiberal 的例句||||His views are markedly illiberal. 他的观点非常狭隘。||||Don't be illiberal in your words to show your love. 不要吝啬自己的语言表达你的情感。

name: imposture
example: 单词 imposture 的例句||||Soiled by her imposture she remains silent. 她背着冒名顶替者的黑锅却一直沉默。||||If they knew, they would see through his imposture straight away. 要是他们知道，他们会立即识破他的招摇撞骗行为。

name: knavery
example: 单词 knavery 的例句||||Knavery may serve, but honesty is best. 欺诈可能有用，诚实却是上策。||||This is flat knavery. 这是十足的无赖作风。

name: machiavellian
example: 单词 machiavellian 的例句||||A Machiavellian plot was suspected. 人们怀疑背后有不可告人的阴谋。||||In this layer, Obama implied American policies that are cautious and Machiavellian. 在这个层面，奥巴马含蓄地表达了美国的谨慎，权谋的（新）政策。

name: magisterial
interpret: adj.威风的，有权威的；adv.威严地
example: 单词 magisterial 的例句||||The colonel's somewhat in a magisterial manner. 上校多少有点威严的神态。||||The Cambridge World History of Human Disease is a magisterial work. 《剑桥世界人类疾病史》是一部权威著作。

name: incertitude
example: 单词 incertitude 的例句||||There are many new trends in economic development with the incertitude growing. 经济发展出现了许多新的趋势，不确实性也显著增强了。||||Incertitude love makes me incapable of work. 不确定的感情让我无法工作。

name: libelous
example: 单词 libelous 的例句||||No evidence has been found in the case so far and therefore it is probably a libelous suit. 查无实据，恐怕是诬告。||||The book was libelous, so the publishers had to call in all copies of it from the bookshops. 这是一本诽谤性的书，所以出版商必须把店里的书全收回去。

name: ligneous
example: 单词 ligneous 的例句||||All these ligneous plants are imported from Russia. 这些木本植物都是从俄国进口而来。||||I have a lot of ligneous doors in my home. 我家里有很多木制的门。

name: amateurish
example: 单词 amateurish 的例句||||The concert was rather an amateurish affair. 这场音乐会颇有些外行客串的味道。||||The paintings looked amateurish. 这些画作看起来只具备业余水准。

name: annexation
example: 单词 annexation 的例句||||He mentioned the Japanese annexation of Korea in 1910 . 他提及1910年日本对朝鲜的吞并。||||I regard the question of annexation as belonging exclusively to the United States and Texas. 我认为合并的问题，完全属于德克萨斯和美国之间的事。

name: amortize
example: 单词 amortize 的例句||||I intend to amortize the total cost of the car over three years. 我打算用三年时间分期偿还汽车的所有费用。||||Business expenses had to be amortized over a 60 month period. 营业费用必须在60个月的时间内分期偿还。

name: anaerobic
example: 单词 anaerobic 的例句||||Anaerobic respiration occurs only in particularly active tissues such as muscles during severe exercise. 厌氧呼吸只有在处于剧烈运动状态的肌肉等特别活跃的组织中才会发生。||||Infection, especially anaerobic infection, is much more apt to occur. 感染，特别是厌氧感染很容易发生。

name: analgesia
example: 单词 analgesia 的例句||||Acupuncture anesthesia and acupuncture analgesia has promoted the acupuncture therapy. 针灸麻醉和针灸止痛促进了针灸疗法的发展。||||Scientists believe swearing elicits an emotional response which leads to what is known as "stress-induced analgesia. "科学家们认为，咒骂引发情绪反应, 该反应引起被称作“压力诱发止痛”的现象。

name: antecedence
example: 单词 antecedence 的例句||||Creative thinking is the antecedence of design. 创新性设计，必须有创新性思维。||||Electric power is antecedence to the development of the national economic. 国家经济的发展，电力是先行。

name: anticlimax
interpret: n.令人扫兴的结局；突降法
example: 单词 anticlimax 的例句||||Travelling in Europe was something of an anticlimax after the years he'd spent in Africa. 他在非洲生活了多年，到欧洲旅行真是有点太平淡了。||||It was an anticlimax when they abandoned the game. 他们放弃比赛，真是扫兴。

name: antihistamine
example: 单词 antihistamine 的例句||||Taking an antihistamine isn't the only way to battle seasonal allergies. 采取抗组织胺并不是唯一防止季节性过敏的方法。||||Antihistamine drugs may offer an effective treatment. 抗组胺剂药物可以提供比较有效的治疗。

name: arboretum
example: 单词 arboretum 的例句||||We can go to the arboretum in the southern suburb. 我们可以去南郊的植物园。||||The arboretum is full of exotic flowers and rare herbs. 植物园里长满了各种奇花异草。

name: aquifer
example: 单词 aquifer 的例句||||An aquifer is a water-bearing rock stratum such as sandstone and chalk. 地下蓄水层是一些有水的岩石层，如沙岩和白垩岩。||||The wine region's first water came from an ancient aquifer. 用来灌溉这个地区葡萄园的第一批水来自古老的地下蓄水层。

name: ascendancy
example: 单词 ascendancy 的例句||||We have had ascendancy over the enemy in the battle. 在战斗中我们已占有优势。||||The extremists are gaining ascendancy. 极端分子正逐渐占据上风。

name: arabesque
interpret: n.阿拉伯式花饰；adj.阿拉伯式图案的
example: 单词 arabesque 的例句||||I like carpets with arabesque patterns. 我喜欢带有阿拉伯式花饰的地毯。||||The Arabesque solution is the answer to a designer's desire for uniqueness. 阿拉伯风为设计师渴望独一无二给出了答案。

name: attune
example: 单词 attune 的例句||||His ear is still attune to the sound of the London suburb. 他的耳朵对伦敦郊区的语音仍然一听就能辨别。||||Our ears are becoming attuned to the noise of the new factory nearby. 我们的耳朵逐渐适应了附近新工厂的噪声。

name: augur
example: 单词 augur 的例句||||Does this news augur war? 这消息预示将有战争吗？||||The signs augur well for tomorrow's weather. 种种征候预示明天天气良好。

name: atonal
example: 单词 atonal 的例句||||The majority always turn an unfavorable attitude towards atonal composition. 大多数人对无调性作品的态度往往是不能接受的。||||People did not accept atonal music at that time. 那时，人们还不接受无调性音乐。

name: cacti
example: 单词 cacti 的例句||||There we could see nothing but cacti. 那里除了仙人掌我们什么也看不到。||||Cacti can survive the lack of rainfall in the desert. 仙人掌在降水稀少的沙漠中也能生存下去。

name: daunting
example: 单词 daunting 的例句||||They were faced with the daunting task of restoring the house. 他们面临着修复房子的艰巨任务。||||Starting a new job can be a daunting prospect. 开始一项新工作有时会让人望而却步。

name: kiln
example: 单词 kiln 的例句||||That morning we fired our first kiln of charcoal. 那天上午，我们烧了我们的第一窑木炭。||||Bricks are baked in a kiln. 砖是在窑里烧成的。

name: laurels
example: 单词 laurels 的例句||||The path was lined with laurels. 小路两旁都种有月桂树。||||He reaped the laurels in the finals. 他在决赛中荣膺冠军。

name: mannerism
example: 单词 mannerism 的例句||||He has this irritating mannerism of constantly scratching his nose. 他老是挠鼻子，这个习惯真让人不舒服。||||Her British accent is just a mannerism picked up on her visit to London. 她的英国口音是她访问伦敦学会的。

name: numinous
example: 单词 numinous 的例句||||They led me to a numinous place that day. 那天他们领着我去了一个神秘的地方。||||Ms Rowling's magic world has no place for the numinous. 罗琳笔下的魔法世界里，没有神秘主义的立足之地。

name: obsolescent
example: 单词 obsolescent 的例句||||Electronic equipment quickly becomes obsolescent. 电子设备淘汰得很快。||||This word is now obsolescent. 这个字现在已废弃不用了。

name: pedantry
example: 单词 pedantry 的例句||||The book is a demonstration of scholarship without pedantry. 这本书表现出学术水平又不故意卖弄学问。||||He fell into a kind of pedantry. 他变得有点喜欢卖弄学问。

name: peevish
example: 单词 peevish 的例句||||A peevish child is unhappy and makes others unhappy. 一个脾气暴躁的孩子自己不高兴也使别人不高兴。||||She glared down at me with a peevish expression on her face. 她低头瞪着我，一脸怒气。

name: ornithologist
example: 单词 ornithologist 的例句||||That area is an ornithologist's paradise. 那个地区是鸟类学家的天堂。||||Now I know how an ornithologist feels. 现在我知道做为一个鸟类学家的感受了。

name: personalities
interpret: n. 诽谤，（对某人容貌、性格等所进行的）人身攻击； 人身攻击；人格, 个性, 名人( personality的名词复数 )
example: 单词 personalities 的例句||||There seemed to be a degree of personalities in her remarks. 她话里有些人身攻击的成分。||||Personalities are not in good taste in general conversation. 在一般的谈话中诽谤他人是不高尚的。

name: pettish
example: 单词 pettish 的例句||||I can't act in pettish to you any further. 我再也不能对你撒娇了。||||He was getting more and more pettish and hysterical. 他变得越来越任性，越来越歇斯底里。

name: rebarbative
example: 单词 rebarbative 的例句||||He became rebarbative and prickly and spiteful. 他变得令人讨厌，易发怒，怀有恶意。||||He has the rebarbative habit that is smoking during eating. 他有边吃饭边抽烟那让人讨厌的习惯。

name: pontifical
example: 单词 pontifical 的例句||||His words criticizing modern society just right indicate his pontifical character. 他用以批评现代社会的言论恰好反映了他自大武断的性格。||||Pontifical aides hope the event may mark a turning point. 教皇助手们希望此次盛典会是一个转折点。

name: scabrous
example: 单词 scabrous 的例句||||Her buried her face in his scabrous shirt. 她把脸埋在他那粗糙的衬衣里。||||Her scabrous novels shocked the public. 她的小说淫秽不堪，公众十分震惊。

name: reincarnate
interpret: vt.使化身，转生；adj.转世化身的
example: 单词 reincarnate 的例句||||Some people believe they may reincarnate in the form of an animal. 有些人相信他们死后可能转生为动物。||||But can the stars reincarnate? 星星能转世吗?

name: renascent
example: 单词 renascent 的例句||||Jesus makes them renascent then, and turns them into wanted appearance. 耶稣于是让他们复活，变成他们想要的样子。||||With the elevation of the integrated power of China, nationalism turns to renascent tendency. 随着中国综合实力的提升，民族主义呈复兴之势。

name: tangential
example: 单词 tangential 的例句||||Too much time was spent discussing tangential issues. 太多的时间花在了讨论那些无关紧要的问题上。||||They thought the whole thing was a side-show, tangential to the real world of business. 他们认为整件事情只是一个插曲，和真正的商界没有多大关系。

name: travelogue
example: 单词 travelogue 的例句||||Marco Polo's travelogue mentions that Kublai Khan sent envoys to Malgache. 马可·波罗游记中提到忽必烈曾派使节到马尔加什。||||The book adds up to a readable, sociopolitical travelogue of America. 总的看，这是一部尚可一读的描述美国社会和政治的游记。

name: viands
example: 单词 viands 的例句||||Greek slaves supplied them with exquisite viands at the slightest nod. 只要他们轻轻点点头希腊奴隶就会供奉给他们精美的食品。||||The family sat down to table, and a frugal meal of cold viands was deposited beforethem. 一家老少，都围着桌子坐下，几样简单的冷食，摆在他们面前。

name: witticism
example: 单词 witticism 的例句||||He tries to lighten his lectures with an occasional witticism. 他有时想用俏皮话使课堂活跃。||||His witticism was as sharp as a marble. 他的打趣话十分枯燥无味。

name: amuck
example: 单词 amuck 的例句||||The sea ran amuck. 海上风暴肆虐。||||The scoundrels who ran amuck will be severely punished. 横行无忌的歹徒将受到严惩。

name: bailment
example: 单词 bailment 的例句||||This custom of tea fete is actually a sprit bailment. 这种用茶祭祀的遗风，实是一种精神寄托。||||In the history of the U. S. grain market, grain elevators several times fell prey to this temptation, spurred by a lack of clarity in bailment law. 在美国谷物市场的历史上，由于保管法不够明晰, 谷仓老板们曾几度经受不住诱惑而堕落。

name: defalcate
example: 单词 defalcate 的例句||||He has defalcated with $50000 of the firm's money. 他盗用了公司5万美金的公款。||||The accountant has been put into jail due to defalcate much money from company. 这个会计由于公司挪用巨额款项而进了监狱。

name: bate
interpret: vt. 使软化；减少；缓和 n. 柔皮剂 vi. 减弱；衰落
example: 单词 bate 的例句||||The cruel landlord would bate him no rent. 那个狠心的地主不肯给他减租。||||I was unable to bate my enthusiasm. 我无法抑制自己的热切的心情。

name: banality
example: 单词 banality 的例句||||Neil's ability to utter banalities never ceased to amaze me. 每次我都很惊讶，尼尔怎么能讲出这么索然无味的东西。||||He couldn't believe the banality of the question. 他无法相信那问题竟如此陈腐。

name: curative?
interpret: adj.治病的；医疗的；有疗效的　n.药品
example: 单词 curative? 的例句||||It was found out that certain herbal medicines had curative effect on AIDS. 经研究发现有些草药对艾滋病有疗效。||||Ancient civilizations believed in the curative powers of fresh air and sunlight. 远古文明相信新鲜的空气和阳光有治病的功效。

name: vindication
example: 单词 vindication 的例句||||There is much to be said in vindication of his claim. 有很多理由可以提出来为他的要求作辩护。||||The result was a vindication of all our efforts. 这一结果表明我们的一切努力是必要的。

name: contiguity
example: 单词 contiguity 的例句||||The contiguity of the house and the garage was a convenience in bad weather. 住宅和车库毗邻，这在天气不好的时候是很方便的。||||Scientists want to investigate the relation between xerophthalmia occurrence and smut contiguity. 科学家们打算探讨干眼症与煤尘接触之间的关系。

name: amputation
example: 单词 amputation 的例句||||In ancient India, adultery was punished by amputation of the nose. 在古代印度，通奸要受到剖鼻的处罚。||||He lived only hours after the amputation. 截肢后，他只活了几个小时。

name: hegira
example: 单词 hegira 的例句||||She made plan for her annual summer hegira to the Miami Beach. 她计划到迈阿密海滩去度过一年一度的暑假。||||Soapy had made his humble arrangements for his annual hegira to the Island. 索丕为自己每年逃亡布莱克韦尔岛尽力做出安排。

name: peal
example: 单词 peal 的例句||||The bells of the cathedral rang out their loud peal. 大教堂响起了响亮的钟声。||||A sudden peal of thunder leaves no time to cover the ears. 迅雷不及掩耳。

name: biannual
example: 单词 biannual 的例句||||I have to make a biannual report next Monday. 下周一我得作半年度报告。||||Our school doctor recommends a biannual visit to the dentist. 我们校医建议一年去看牙医两次。

name: denotation
example: 单词 denotation 的例句||||A good dictionary will give us the connotation of a word as well as its denotation. 一本好字典不仅要告诉我们一个字的字面意义，同时还要告诉我们该字的言外之意。||||The denotation of the word "home" is "place where one lives, " but it has many connotations. “家”这个词的直接意义是指“人居住的地方”，但是它还有许多涵义。

name: divers
example: 单词 divers 的例句||||He chose divers of them, who were asked to accompany him. 他选择他们当中的几个人，要他们和他作伴。||||Two divers work together while a standby diver remains on the surface. 两名潜水员协同工作，同时有一名候补潜水员留在水面上。

name: bagatelle
example: 单词 bagatelle 的例句||||To him money is a bagatelle. 金钱对他来说不算一回事。||||One day, they argued for a bagatelle of their children. 一天，夫妻为了孩子的一件小事吵起来。

name: chronometer
example: 单词 chronometer 的例句||||Murchison's eyes followed the hand of his chronometer. 莫奇生的眼睛追随着他的时计的秒针。||||My watch is more expensive because it's a chronometer. 我的手表是精密型的，所以要比你的贵。

name: cryptogram
example: 单词 cryptogram 的例句||||A government uses a cryptogram or secret code. 政府使用密码或暗号。||||He regarded the universe as a cryptogram set by the Almighty. 他将宇宙视为上帝用密文书写的文件。

name: gendarme
example: 单词 gendarme 的例句||||A gendarme was crossing the court. 一个宪兵正在院子里踱步。||||While he was at work, a gendarme passed, observed him, and demanded his papers. 正在他工作时，有个警察走过，注意到他，便向他要证件。

name: homonym
example: 单词 homonym 的例句||||Confusion of homonym is a long-term disturbing problem in current Chinese Braille. 同音词混淆是长期困扰现行盲文的问题。||||The nickname comes from the Chinese word for returnees, haiguipai, a homonym for sea turtles. 在中文里，这类人被称为“海归派”。

name: gondola
interpret: n.威尼斯的平底轻舟；飞船的吊船
example: 单词 gondola 的例句||||The road is too narrow to allow the passage of gondola. 这条街太窄大型货车不能通过。||||I have a gondola here. 我开来了一条平底船。

name: filet
example: 单词 filet 的例句||||They feasted us on filet mignon and strawberry shortcake. 他们拿出鱼片和草莓松脆饼盛情款待我们。||||You cannot make filet mignon out of chopped liver. 你不能从品质差的肉制造品质高的肉。

name: monograph
example: 单词 monograph 的例句||||This monograph belongs to the category of serious popular books. 这本专著是一本较高深的普及读物。||||It's a monograph you wrote six years ago. 这是你六年前写的的专论。

name: malefactor
example: 单词 malefactor 的例句||||If he wasn't a malefactor, we wouldn't have brought him before you. 如果他不是坏人，我们是不会把他带来见你的。||||The malefactor was sentenced to death. 这个罪犯被判死刑。

name: legerdemain
example: 单词 legerdemain 的例句||||The lawyer confused the jury with his legal legerdemain. 那律师以他合法的把戏把陪审团搞糊涂了。||||Some accused the White House of legerdemain. 有人谴责白宫在玩花招。

name: tautology
example: 单词 tautology 的例句||||Modern logicians regard it as little more than tautology. 现代的逻辑学家仅仅把它看作同义反复。||||What's the first excellence in a lawyer?  Tautology. What the second?  Tautology. 律师最擅长的是什么？是同义反复。其次呢？同义反复。再其次呢？同义反复。

name: sate
example: 单词 sate 的例句||||Nothing could sate the careerist's greed for power. 什么也满足不了这个野心家的权力欲。||||I am sate with opera after listening to it for a whole weekend. 听了整整一个周末的歌剧，我觉得腻了。

name: recherche
example: 单词 recherche 的例句||||Applicants should have good PC skills with common office software, email and internet recherche. 在办公软件、电子邮件，网络检索等个人电脑应用方面, 申请人应具备良好的操作技能。||||The restaurant prides itself on its recherche menu. 饭店以其精美的菜单自豪。

name: scintillate
example: 单词 scintillate 的例句||||His eyes scintillated excitation. 他的眼睛闪烁激动的目光。||||The stars scintillate. 星星闪烁发光。

name: terrapin
example: 单词 terrapin 的例句||||The diamondback terrapin in this undated photo has two heads. 这张未标日期的图片上的钻纹龟有两个头。||||He also owns a two-headed goat, a two-headed terrapin and the world's only living three-headed turtle. 他还拥有双头山羊、淡水龟，以及世上现存唯一的三头乌龟。

name: theocracy
example: 单词 theocracy 的例句||||Shangzhou was an important period for the formation and development of theocracy. 商周时期是神权政治形成与发展的重要阶段。||||The Muslim brothers look as if they will opt for civil society rather than theocracy. 穆斯林兄弟看起来好像更适合文明的社会，而非神权统治。

name: vainglorious
example: 单词 vainglorious 的例句||||She is a vainglorious woman. 她是个爱虚荣的女性。||||Let us not become vainglorious, provoking one another, envying one another. 不要贪图虚荣，彼此惹气，互相嫉妒。

name: valetudinarian
example: 单词 valetudinarian 的例句||||She affected to be spunky about her ailments and afflictions, but she was in fact an utterly self-centered valetudinarian. 她装做对自己的失调和苦恼若无其事，但是实际上她是为自己的健康状况非常发愁的人。||||The valetudinarian alternated two hours of work with one hour of rest. 那个体弱多病的人每工作两小时就要歇一小时。

name: vegetate
example: 单词 vegetate 的例句||||After a hard day's work, I vegetate in front of the television. 经过一整天劳累，我瘫在电视机前一动不动。||||He spends all his free time at home vegetating in front of the TV. 他一有空闲时间就窝在家里看电视。

name: unguent
example: 单词 unguent 的例句||||The doctor applied an unguent to the wound, which speedily healed it. 医生给伤口涂了些油膏，伤口很快就愈合了。||||The father smeared the face of his son with a powerful unguent. 父亲用一种非常有效的油膏涂抹在儿子的脸上。

name: verbiage
example: 单词 verbiage 的例句||||Stripped of their pretentious verbiage, his statements come dangerously close to inviting racial hatred. 抛开那些夸大其词的冗词赘语不论，他的言论有挑起种族仇恨的危险。||||Even in little 140-character bites, that's a lot of verbiage. 即使限制在一条140个字也有很大一部分是废话。

name: verdigris
example: 单词 verdigris 的例句||||His pockets are full of red lead and verdigris. 他的衣袋里装满铅丹和铜绿。||||Verdigris has spread all over that abandoned copper pot. 那把已经废弃的铜壶上长满了铜锈。

name: yokel
example: 单词 yokel 的例句||||The clothes make him look like a yokel. 这件衣服让他看起来像个乡巴佬。||||George is not an ordinary yokel. 乔治不是一个普通的粗人。

name: usurpation
example: 单词 usurpation 的例句||||The struggle during this transitional stage is to oppose Chiang Kai-shek's usurpation of the fruits of victory in the War of Resistance. 过渡阶段的斗争，就是反对蒋介石篡夺抗战胜利果实的斗争。||||This is an unjustified usurpation of my authority. 你是在非法纂夺我的权力。

name: victuals
example: 单词 victuals 的例句||||A plateful of coarse victuals was set before him. 一盘粗劣的剩余饭食放到了他的面前。||||There are no more victuals for the pig. 猪没有吃的啦。

name: calcify
interpret: vi. 钙化；变成石灰质 vt. 使钙化；使思想僵化
example: 单词 calcify 的例句||||Old folks can calcify. 老年人可能出现钙化现象。||||The rock calcified over the centuries. 经过几个世纪，石头发生了钙化。

name: bamboozle
example: 单词 bamboozle 的例句||||He was bamboozled by con men. 他被骗子骗了。||||He bamboozled Mercer into defeat. 他骗得默瑟认了输。

name: camaraderie
example: 单词 camaraderie 的例句||||The camaraderie among fellow employees made the tedious work just bearable. 同事之间的情谊使枯燥乏味的工作变得还能忍受。||||Some bosses are formal and have occasional interactions, while others prefer continual camaraderie. 有些老板很刻板，偶尔才和下属互动一下；有些则喜欢和下属打成一片。

name: bathetic
example: 单词 bathetic 的例句||||Dickens's readers really wanted to feel the kind of bathetic sadness that he tried to evoke. 狄更斯的读者非常希望感受到他试图唤起的那种虚假的悲伤。||||Instead I've compromised by writing a slightly less bathetic list of all the things I must do today. 相反, 我采取了折衷的办法，列了一张稍微不那么平庸的清单，写明我今日必须完成的各项事务。

name: belligerence
example: 单词 belligerence 的例句||||He could be accused of passion, but never belligerence. 可以说他很冲动，但不能说他爱挑事。||||He was almost back to his belligerent mood of twelve months ago. 他故态复萌，几乎又像一年前那样咄咄逼人了。

name: biota
example: 单词 biota 的例句||||They have had serious effects upon the biota of stream. 它们对河流中的生物群体产生严重影响。||||Historical biogeography attempts to reconstruct the biota history of the earth. 历史生物地理学重建生物区系历史。

name: checkered
example: 单词 checkered 的例句||||The ground under the trees was checkered with sunlight and shade. 林地光影交错。||||He has a checkered past in the government. 他过去在政界浮沉。

name: dissonant
example: 单词 dissonant 的例句||||His voice is drowned by the dissonant scream of a siren outside. 她的声音被外面杂乱刺耳的警报声吞没了。||||They chose to include all of these dissonant voices together. 他们把那些不和谐的声音也放在了里面

name: heterogeneity
example: 单词 heterogeneity 的例句||||The heterogeneity and uneven development of China's economy are rather advantageous in the war of resistance. 中国经济的不统一、不平衡，对于抗日战争反为有利。||||In heterogeneity is creation of the world. 世界产生自异质性。

name: immersion
example: 单词 immersion 的例句||||The dirt on the bottom of the bath didn't encourage total immersion. 浴缸底有污垢，不宜全身浸泡于其中。||||The wood had become swollen from prolonged immersion. 因长时间浸泡，木头发胀了。

name: impresario
interpret: n.歌剧团的经理人；乐团指挥
example: 单词 impresario 的例句||||The impresario will present an expanded series of concerts next season. 下个季节将举办一次大型的系列音乐会。||||The impresario had buttoned his astrakhan coat. 乐团经理扣好了羔皮外套。

name: meridian
example: 单词 meridian 的例句||||All places on the same meridian have the same longitude. 在同一子午线上的地方都有相同的经度。||||He is now at the meridian of his intellectual power. 他现在正值智力全盛期。

name: lissome
example: 单词 lissome 的例句||||The lissome birchbark canoe seemed to be a fish, so easily did it cut through the rolling black waves and ranks of ice. 轻盈的桦皮舟像一条大鱼，在滚滚的黑色波涛和冰排中间飞一般地前进。||||His works often present a smart and lissome feeling. 他的作品通常给人以灵动而轻盈的观感。

name: monolithic
example: 单词 monolithic 的例句||||Don't think this gang is monolithic. 不要以为这帮人是铁板一块。||||Mathematics is not a single monolithic structure of absolute truth. 数学并不是绝对真理的单一整体结构。

name: liturgical
example: 单词 liturgical 的例句||||This period corresponds with the liturgical season of Christmas. 这个时期与圣诞节的礼拜季节相一致。||||This is a book of liturgical forms. 这是一本关于礼拜仪式的书。

name: miscegenation
example: 单词 miscegenation 的例句||||It was only in 1967 that the United States finally struck down its anti miscegenation laws. 直到1967年，美国才废除了反种族通婚的法律。||||In contemporary times, Brazilians have come to regard miscegenation as a defining national trait. 在当代，巴西人已经把种族通婚看作是鲜明的国家特征。

name: misogynist
example: 单词 misogynist 的例句||||He quickly gained the reputation of being a misogynist. 他很快地赢得了“厌恶女性者”的这一名声。||||Nice try, but you're a misanthrope, not a misogynist. 不错了，你讨厌的是世界，不是女人。

name: qualms
example: 单词 qualms 的例句||||He felt no qualms about borrowing money from friends. 他没有对于从朋友那里借钱感到不安。||||He has no qualms about lying. 他撒谎毫不内疚。

name: parricide
example: 单词 parricide 的例句||||In ancient Greek stories, Oedipus was a parricide. 在古希腊故事里，俄狄浦斯是个杀父者。||||There's a case of parricide immediately after, which will take them some time. 在您之后，立刻就要办一件弑父案。

name: ostracism
example: 单词 ostracism 的例句||||Until I emigrated to America, my family and I endured progressive ostracism and discrimination. 我的家庭和我自己忍受着变本加厉的排斥和歧视直到我移居美国。||||For the first time in her life the import and horror of social ostracism flashed upon her. 她生平第一次突然想到遭受社交界排斥的意义与可怕。

name: perjure
example: 单词 perjure 的例句||||The man scrupled to perjure himself. 这人发伪誓时迟疑了起来。||||She would rather perjure herself than admit to her sins. 她宁愿在法庭上撒谎也不愿承认她的罪行。

name: teleology
example: 单词 teleology 的例句||||Kant identifies with this view deeply, but he believes teleology finally. 康德深以这一观点为是，但他最终相信目的论。||||In general it's hard to do without teleology when we're thinking about ethics, justice and moral argument. 当我们思考伦理、正义和道德时，一般很难不用到目的论。

name: tithe
interpret: n.十分之一税；v.课什一税，缴什一税
example: 单词 tithe 的例句||||It's not Christ plus your tithe. 这不是基督再加上你的什一税。||||The bible tells us that the tithe is the lords. 圣经说十分之一是献给主的。

name: stagnate
interpret: vi. 停滞；淤塞；变萧条 vt. 使淤塞；使沉滞；使萧条
example: 单词 stagnate 的例句||||Where the masses are not roused, work will stagnate. 哪里不发动群众，哪里的工作就死气沉沉。||||Taiwan's economy is likely to stagnate for a long time to come. 台湾经济很可能会停滞很长一段时间。

name: virago
example: 单词 virago 的例句||||The virago vomited out curses on that tramp. 那悍妇怒骂那流浪汉。||||His wife is a virago. 他的妻子是母老虎。

name: bellwether
interpret: n.系铃的公羊，前导，领导者，群众的首领
example: 单词 bellwether 的例句||||University campuses are often the bellwether of change. 大学校园往往引领变革的新潮。||||For decades the company was the bellwether of the British economy. 几十年来，这家公司一直是英国经济的晴雨表。

name: caveat
interpret: n.警告； 防止误解的说明
example: 单词 caveat 的例句||||I would offer a caveat for those who want to join me in the dual calling. 为防止发生误解，我想对那些想要步我后尘的人提出警告。||||As I have written before, that's quite a caveat. 正如我以前所写，那确实是个警告。

name: cavort
example: 单词 cavort 的例句||||You can enjoy a quick snack while your children cavort in the sand. 趁孩子们在沙滩上嬉戏，你可以吃点小吃。||||Stop cavorting around and sit still, just for five minutes! 别欢蹦乱跳的，坐好了，就五分钟！

name: gaffe
interpret: n.（社交上令人不快的）失言，失态
example: 单词 gaffe 的例句||||I had no idea of the gaffe which I was committing. 我不清楚我犯了什么错误。||||He made an embarrassing gaffe at the convention last weekend. 他在上周末的会议上出了洋相，狼狈不堪。

name: ebullience
example: 单词 ebullience 的例句||||His natural ebullience began to return. 他开始恢复与生俱来的热情奔放。||||She burst into the room with her usual ebullience. 她像往常一样兴高采烈地冲进了房间。

name: echelon
interpret: n.梯队；组织系统中的等级；v.排成梯队
example: 单词 echelon 的例句||||What kind of friends can be considered the first echelon of the friends? 那什么样的朋友才能算第一梯队的朋友？||||These are the first echelon members. 这些是我们的第一梯队的队员。

name: elegy
example: 单词 elegy 的例句||||Good heavens, what would be more tragic than that elegy! 天哪，还有什么比那首挽歌更悲伤的呢！||||His book is not intended to be a complete history but a personal elegy. 他的书与其说是一部完整的历史，更像是一篇个人挽歌。

name: elitism
example: 单词 elitism 的例句||||Many people believe that private education encourages elitism. 许多人认为私立教育助长精英主义。||||We must avoid cultural elitism. 我们必须避免文化精英主义。

name: glade
interpret: n.林间空地，一片表面有草的沼泽低地
example: 单词 glade 的例句||||In the midst of a glade were several huts. 林中的空地中间有几间小木屋。||||The family had their lunch in the glade. 全家在林中的空地上吃了午饭。

name: filibuster
example: 单词 filibuster 的例句||||A senator dragged the subject in as a filibuster. 一个参议员硬把这个题目拉扯进来，作为一种阻碍议事的手法。||||The democrats organized a filibuster in the senate. 民主党党员在参议院上组织了阻挠议事。

name: filigree
interpret: n.金银丝做的工艺品；v.用金银细丝饰品装饰；用华而不实的饰品装饰；adj.金银细丝工艺的
example: 单词 filigree 的例句||||The frost made beautiful filigree on the window pane. 寒霜在玻璃窗上形成了美丽的花纹。||||The art filigree tapestry is elegant and magnificent. 嵌金银丝艺术挂毯，绚丽雅典。

name: flange
example: 单词 flange 的例句||||These include gusset plates welded to the flange. 这些包括焊接到翼缘上的节点板。||||Three structures have exhibited cracking at the ends of flange gusset plates. 已有三个结构在翼缘节点板端部出现了裂纹.

name: glitch
example: 单词 glitch 的例句||||There is a glitch in the computer program somewhere. 这个计算机程序中的某个部分有点小问题。||||It could just be a random glitch that can be solved by restarting the machine. 可能只是一个小故障，重新启动主机就能解决了。

name: embolden
example: 单词 embolden 的例句||||Emboldened by the wine, he went over to introduce himself to her. 他借酒壮胆，走上前去向她作自我介绍。||||The Prime Minister was steadily emboldened by the discovery that he faced no opposition. 发现自己并未遭到反对，首相渐渐有了信心。

name: jaunty
interpret: adj．愉快的，满足的；adv.心满意足地，洋洋得意地；n.心满意足；洋洋得意
example: 单词 jaunty 的例句||||She cocked her hat at a jaunty angle. 她把帽子歪戴成俏皮的样子。||||The happy boy walked with jaunty steps. 这个快乐的孩子以轻快活泼的步子走着。

name: jitter
interpret: vi. 抖动，[电子] 跳动；战战兢兢；神经过敏 vt. 紧张地说；使…惶恐不安 n. 振动，剧跳；紧张不安
example: 单词 jitter 的例句||||I jittered when the headmaster came in. 当校长进来的时候，我一阵紧张。||||Emerging-market bonds and shares, for instance, may jitter further. 例如，新兴市场债券和股票可能更加震荡。

name: imp
example: 单词 imp 的例句||||What a little imp you are! 你这个淘气包！ ||||There's a little imp always running with him. 他总有一个小鬼跟着。

name: knotty
interpret: adj.有结的，多节的，多瘤的，棘手的
example: 单词 knotty 的例句||||Under his leadership, many knotty problems were smoothly solved. 在他的领导下，许多伤脑筋的问题都迎刃而解。||||She met with a lot of knotty problems. 她碰上了许多棘手的问题。

name: natty
example: 单词 natty 的例句||||Cliff was a natty dresser. 克利夫是讲究衣着整洁美观的人。||||Please keep this office natty and use the binaries provided. 请保持办公室整洁，使用所提供的垃圾箱。

name: malinger
example: 单词 malinger 的例句||||She was told by her doctor that she was malingering. 医生告诉她，她这是在装病。||||I'm not going to malinger and I don't want to risk losing my job. 我不会装病，我才不想冒丢饭碗的危险。

name: adventitious
example: 单词 adventitious 的例句||||The strike was broken, of course, but mainly by a series of adventitious developments. 罢工是中断了，但主要还是由于发生了一系列意外事件。||||His knowledge of this particular bishop was somewhat adventitious. 他对主教当中这一位的了解，似乎多少事出偶然。

name: aeon
example: 单词 aeon 的例句||||Aeons ago, there were deserts where there is now fertile land. 现在是肥沃土地的地方在很久很久以前曾是一片片沙漠。||||Aeon on aeon thou existed in beauty. 你永世永世活在美里。

name: impiety
example: 单词 impiety 的例句||||His last act must be a deed of impiety. 他最后的行为就是这一种不孝。||||His remarks show impiety to religion. 他的话表现出对宗教的不敬。

name: agronomist
example: 单词 agronomist 的例句||||The agronomist suggested growing rice on the dried river bed. 那位农学家建议在干涸的河床上种水稻。||||She has elected to become an agronomist. 她决心做一个农学家。

name: ambrosia
example: 单词 ambrosia 的例句||||Later Aphrodite herself brought ambrosia. 后来阿芙洛狄特亲自带了仙肴。||||People almost everywhere are buying it as if it were the biggest glass of ambrosia in the world for a nickel. 几乎所有地方的人们都在买它，就好像它是世界上能用五分钱买到的最大瓶的美味。

name: arrant
example: 单词 arrant 的例句||||He is an arrant fool. 他是个大傻瓜。||||That's arrant nonsense. 那完全是一派胡言。

name: asceticism
example: 单词 asceticism 的例句||||I am not speaking here about asceticism or abstinence. 我说的并不是苦行主义或禁欲主义。||||Chaucer affirmed man's rights to pursue earthly happiness and epposed asceticism. 乔叟强调人权，尤其是追求今生今世幸福快乐的权力，反对神权与禁欲主义。

name: ashen
example: 单词 ashen 的例句||||His face was ashen and wet with sweat. 他面如土色，汗如雨下。||||Her ashen face showed how much the news had shocked her. 她灰白的脸显示出那消息使她多么震惊。

name: askew
example: 单词 askew 的例句||||His glasses had been knocked askew by the blow. 他的眼镜一下子被打歪了。||||Her hat was slightly askew. 她的帽子戴得有点斜。

name: asseverate
interpret: vt.郑重声明；（严正地）宣称；断言
example: 单词 asseverate 的例句||||I will asseverate my conviction that she is guilty. 我坚持有罪判决，因为她是有罪的。||||They are explainable as a species of mental atavism. 这些都可以解释为一种精神的返祖现象。

name: jeremiad
example: 单词 jeremiad 的例句||||Throughout literary history, many people have written works which have added to the tradition of the American jeremiad. 在整个文学史上，很多人的作品都为传统美国悲叹文学添砖加瓦。||||Jeremiad wreathes upon my feeling, while shadow of shiver covers my mood. 悲叹盘旋在我的脑海里，而颤抖的阴影覆盖了我的思绪。

name: jingoism
example: 单词 jingoism 的例句||||They have stripped the veneer of jingoism from the play, by showing war in its true horror. 他们剥除了极端爱国主义的外衣，在剧中展示了战争恐怖的实质。||||Patriotism can turn into jingoism very quickly. 爱国主义可以很快转变为沙文主义。

name: insouciant
example: 单词 insouciant 的例句||||But not all central bankers are so insouciant. 然而，不是所有的央行人士都对此高枕无忧。||||Americans are remarkably insouciant about this development. 美国人对这个数字漫无关心。

name: integument
example: 单词 integument 的例句||||The first protector against the entry of microorganisms is the integument. 抗御微生物进入体内的第一道防线是皮肤。||||The cells of the integument and nucellus of some plants form perfectly normal embryos. 某些植物的珠被和珠心细胞形成完全正常的胚。

name: interdict
interpret: vt.限制；禁止；n.正式禁止；禁令
example: 单词 interdict 的例句||||Troops could be ferried in to interdict drug shipments. 可以把军队渡运过来阻截毒品的装运。||||Interdict could also be sought for the protection of public interests. 禁令也可以用于保护公共利益。

name: laity
example: 单词 laity 的例句||||The Church and the laity were increasingly active in charity work. 教会与俗众越来越积极参与慈善工作。||||Clergy and laity alike are divided in their views. 神职人员和信众同样都观点各异。

name: intransigence
example: 单词 intransigence 的例句||||He often appeared angry and frustrated by the intransigence of both sides. 他似乎常常为双方各不相让而生气沮丧。||||Yet for North Korea, intransigence is the norm. 不过对朝鲜来说，决不妥协是其一贯作风。

name: lapidary
interpret: n.宝石匠；adj.宝石的；简洁优雅的
example: 单词 lapidary 的例句||||The lapidary considers several features of stones before assessing their value. 这位宝石专家在评估宝石的价值之前会考虑几项要点。||||He is a professional lapidary who cuts, polishes and engraves precious stones. 他是一位宝石鉴定家，专门切割，磨光，及雕刻珍贵的钻石。

name: inveigh
example: 单词 inveigh 的例句||||A lot of his writings inveigh against luxury and riches. 他的很多文章都痛批奢华与财富。||||The detective had, indeed, good reasons to inveigh against the bad luck which pursued him. 说实在话，一点也不能怪费克斯咒骂他一再碰上的坏运气。

name: lecherous
example: 单词 lecherous 的例句||||Her husband was described in court as a lecherous scoundrel. 她的丈夫在法庭上被描绘成一个好色的无赖。||||Men enjoy all the beautiful bones, but do not mistake him lecherous. 男人骨子里全都喜欢美女，但千万别误以为他好色。

name: lechery
example: 单词 lechery 的例句||||When they are idle, they indulge themselves into comfort, lechery, crapulence and gluttony. 他们闲散时，就沉溺于安乐、纵欲、暴饮、暴食。||||His lechery made him the enemy of every self-respecting husband and father in the county. 他的好色放浪使他成为全县所有自尊自重的丈夫和父亲的公敌。

name: nave
example: 单词 nave 的例句||||People gathered in the nave of the house. 人们聚拢在房子的中间。||||The family on the other side of the nave had a certain look about them, too. 在中殿另一边的那一家人，也有着自己特有的相貌。

name: libidinous
example: 单词 libidinous 的例句||||Powell let his libidinous imagination run away with him. 鲍威尔淫心顿起，浮想联翩。||||Now it was believed that men were much more naturally libidinous and liable to seduce women. 现在人们相信，男人天生要好色得多，要对勾引女人承担责任。

name: libido
example: 单词 libido 的例句||||Lack of sleep is a major factor in loss of libido. 睡眠不足是导致性欲丧失的一个主要因素。||||Ginseng can increase energy and libido, which can help solve intimacy problems. 人参可以增加活力和性欲，从而帮助解决亲密关系的问题。

name: limbo
example: 单词 limbo 的例句||||His life seemed stuck in limbo and he could neither go forward nor go back. 他的生活好像陷入了不知所措的境地，进退两难。||||I didn't know whether my family was alive or dead. I felt as if I was in limbo. 我不知道家人是生是死，感觉自己茫然无措。

name: limn
example: 单词 limn 的例句||||The report limned a desperate situation. 那报道描述出一个严重的情况。||||I always have the impulsiveness to limn the whole world. 我总有一种冲动，想要描述整个世界。

name: nexus
example: 单词 nexus 的例句||||Shared ambition is the vital nexus between them. 共同的志向是把他们联结在一起的重要纽带。||||Either way, the nexus between the consumer and consumer prices is important. 无论那个方面，消费者与消费价格之间的关系是至关重要的。

name: oblation
example: 单词 oblation 的例句||||Thinkers and poets throughout the ages have offered the courtesan the oblation of their mercy. 各个时期的思想家和诗人都把仁慈的怜悯心奉献给娼家女子。||||Each family has their own ancestor for oblation. 谁家也不缺个祖宗来供奉。

name: palaver
example: 单词 palaver 的例句||||We don't want all that palaver, do we? 我们不想那样小题大做，不是吗？||||Progress is neither proclamation nor palaver. 进步不是宣言，也不是空谈。

name: nubile
example: 单词 nubile 的例句||||Rich old men often like to be surrounded by nubile young women. 一些上了年纪的富翁总喜欢被到了适婚年龄的年轻女人围绕。||||Why is this current television obsession with older men and nubile young women? 现在的电视节目为什么这么喜欢描写老男人和妙龄性感女郎的故事呢？

name: oculist
example: 单词 oculist 的例句||||I wonder if the oculist could fit me in next Friday. 不知眼科医生能否在下星期五给我安排一个时间。||||If your eyes are infected, you must go to an oculist. 如果你的眼睛受到感染，就要去看眼科医生。

name: queasy
example: 单词 queasy 的例句||||I felt a little queasy on the ship. 我在船上觉得有点晕眩想呕吐。||||He was very prone to seasickness and already felt queasy. 他快晕船了，已经感到恶心了。

name: ogle
interpret: vt. 向…抛媚眼；注视 vi. 做媚眼 n. 眉目传情；媚眼
example: 单词 ogle 的例句||||He likes to ogle at the pretty girls. 他爱盯着漂亮的女孩子。||||All she did was hang around ogling the men in the factory. 她所做的就只是在工厂里荡来荡去，朝男人抛媚眼。

name: paraphernalia
example: 单词 paraphernalia 的例句||||Can you move all your paraphernalia out of the way? 你可以把所有的随身物品移开吗？||||All my fishing paraphernalia is in the car. 我的鱼具都在汽车里。

name: onus
example: 单词 onus 的例句||||The onus is on government departments to show cause why information cannot bedisclosed. 政府部门有责任说明不能把信息公开的理由。||||The onus of proof lies with you. 你有责任提供证据。

name: quorum
example: 单词 quorum 的例句||||The meeting is adjourned since there is no quorum. 因为没有法定人数会议休会。||||Three members shall constitute a quorum. 三名成员可组成法定人数。

name: parlance
example: 单词 parlance 的例句||||The term "meta directory" came into industry parlance two years ago. 两年前，商业界开始用“元目录”这个术语。||||The phrase is common diplomatic parlance for spying. 这种说法是指代间谍行为的常用外交辞令。

name: sadistic
example: 单词 sadistic 的例句||||There was a sadistic streak in him. 他有虐待狂的倾向。||||The prisoners rioted against mistreatment by sadistic guards. 囚犯因不堪忍受狱警施虐而发动了暴乱。

name: talon
interpret: n.爪；（如爪般的）手指；爪状物
example: 单词 talon 的例句||||Can you get a little tighter with the talon? 你能不能把摄像探头固定住不动？||||This kind of spice is made of eagle's talon and has a unique flavor. 这种香料味道独特，是用鹰爪作原料制成的。

name: tarn
